Although our original brunch plans fell through, I'm glad I got to try the toast because I've passed by farm:table and put it on my list of places to visit.
author: Joanna C.

description:
This was my first stop in SF. It was a small cute cafe. Small menu to pick from but has a good variety of sweet and savory. 

I ordered the daily fruit toast which was a perfect introduction to SF's toast culture. Have never had such creamy mascarpone with spot on amount of sweetness and topped with fresh fruits and pecans for crunch. The warm fresh brioche bread only added to the flavor of the dish. 

I also ordered the char coal latte, again my first time trying it. I am not a fan of it but it was pretty decent. For those who haven't tried it yet, doesn't taste like anything really. Just skim milk with slight sweetness to it. Should try at least once at least I would say.

All in all, I would go again for the daily toast!
author: Prashansa D.

description: The place is fairly close to the Union Square. It was a cute little place. They have various different selections of latte choices. It is great for breakfast and brunch. It is a very small place for dinning. There's only one table inside with a few set up outside. I would recommend the charcoal latte. It was delicious. The breakfast items are a bit expensive but they are delicious and worth trying.
author: Arlene S.

description: We had a seasonal fruit on pan cake and egg on croissant. They tasted okay but looked great on photo. I would say it is not worth waiting a long line for.
author: Vincent L.

description: The line up at this place is super long during weekend. But it was totally worth the wait! I ordered French toast. Ingredients are so fresh. It was a great start of a Sunday!
author: Jocelyn Z.

description: This place is a 10. So fresh. So good. So cute. Love this place. I'll be back everyday I'm visiting. This place is a must.
author: Steph T.

description:
Went here because of the reviews. 
Croissant was mushy , my wife had a salmon sandwich where the bread was the end cut and it was dry. 
It is a busy place but we didn't like it.
author: Detlev H.

description:
I've had this place bookmarked for a long time. After seeing all the cute photos of this breakfast/brunch spot, I realized I haven't yet been so I made my way there on a day I wasn't too busy. 

farm : table is located on Post Street in the Lower Nob Hill area of San Francisco. Like all places in the city, parking is mostly street parking. This area was particularly hard to find any especially during the holidays so we just parked in the Union Square parking lot. It's just a few blocks away from there. 

I have to admit I wasn't really trying to go here at first. The brunch place I was looking forward to eating at was closed that day so I chose to eat at the next closest place which I bookmarked. (LOVE bookmarks!) The space itself is literally like a hole in the wall with a colorful window by the entrance where 2 customers can sit and eat. There's also a square communal table inside which fits 6 people comfortably if you don't mind sharing. On nice days, there's few "seats" (and I say that loosely) on the sidewalk. The hipster vibe fits well with the feel of San Francisco. 

They don't have a large variety of items for breakfast which was ok with me because it is a tiny kitchen in the back. We ordered what most customers get, but we weren't blown-away by the breakfast items. I felt for the price, I should've gotten something that I couldn't made at home myself. That's probably my only gripe, but other than that, it's a cute place to grab a quick bite. Maybe I'll try the Daily Toast next time. 

Egg on Croissant : The sandwich on the whole was good and filling for breakfast. It has a hard-boiled egg inside. (i would prefer soft-boiled.) I would order this again if I was hungry. 

Tuna Melt : This was ok. It doesn't look very pleasant, but my guy thought it was good. After all, it's just tuna, tomato, and cheese on toast. Not really worth the price though.
author: Julie W.

description:
We were greeted by a pleasant young lady who took our order. One in our group asked if they could make the Special of the Day (grilled cheese and tomato soup) with gluten free bread due to Celiac Disease. She replied that they could absolutely do that and we paid for our order. 

While getting water, the older woman who was cooking looked at the order and asked the cashier, "What the f#@! is this, gluten free?" The cashier explained to her that we wanted one sandwich made with gluten free bread. The cook continued to curse and verbalize her displeasure with the request but begrudgingly made it. 

This is a tiny place and everyone inside could here her. It was embarrassing and totally unnecessary. I'm so sick of people who spout tolerance and acceptance of others, being those you are the least...in San Francisco of all places. 

The only reason for the second star is the food was really good and the other employee was very friendly.
author: Richard B.

description:
Farm : table (pronounced "farm to table" and not "farm table" I think???) is a pretty great spot for brunch, coffee, and breakfast but at the times you PROBABLY want to be there -- Saturday and Sunday mornings -- it's rough going. 

The space gets packed and it's already a shoebox with a communal table inside (the eponymous farm to table table) and a parklet outside. Big long lines, but food is served super fast once you've ordered. Best of luck finding a spot.

The good news is that the food and coffee all rock. The egg sandwich on a croissant is always on the menu, always good, and just about the right size for a non-gutbusting breakfast. They do a ton of tea, too, which I haven't tried but it's all T-We, which people who are super into tea seem to be particularly super into.

Goes without saying, but if you live in the area and want to drop in on a weekday morning everything bad about it (crowds, tourists, etc) are non-issues, so have at.

Try that egg croissant first. The quiche-type deal is real good, too.
author: Jim M.

description: Perfect SF breakfast place! 5 Thumbs up! If you are staying in one of the 50 surrounding Marriotts and you are a Foodie come here! I lived in SF for 12 years in the past and this classic quality SF Foodie stuff in a funky surrounding . Those brioche toasts with Mascarpone and farm fresh fruit are out-of-this world. Washed that down with a Nutella Latté and was in 7th heaven
author: Michael H.

description:
What's so special about this place is that it's literally just a tiny kitchen with maybe 2-3 people seating. It's small, very cozy, shabby ambiance in the middle of the city.

Their name speaks for itself. Their menu switches almost everyday because they literally get local fresh farm ingredients.  

Their daily toast with in-season fruits is a popular here. They top it off with pistachios. SO. GOOD. 

I also got the cardamom lavender chai. Neither flavors were too overpowering and complimented well. 

They have a great location and really, if you want to experience San Francisco, try this place out and then eat somewhere in union square!
author: Nicky A.

description: 4 stars with a caveat: very small portions and a bit pricey. IF money is not an issue, IF, unlike me, you're not very hungry and are a medium to small person who will be satisfied with what in essence are children meal portions...THEN, this is a good place to grab a quick bite. Ingredients are fresh, flavors are simple but satisfying. Staff is quick and courteous. Very tight place inside, not a lot of sitting options. If SF weather is cold or wet and you have no option but to sit outside... take it to go.
author: Hiram M.

description: Food was great and the service was just as good. We arrived just before the crowd and even though it's a small spot people eat and go, seating shouldn't be to big of a problem. I wish they had a sink to wash up before eating. I would definitely come again. Maybe for lunch...I think they serve lunch here too.
author: Foodie S.

description:
Damn it, can I just own a place like farm:table and be a millionaire (if you don't catch my drift, I'm saying that this hole in the wall is highly successful). On a Tuesday in the random AM hours, the place had a line. WTF. But, I understand why. 

I came for a coffee, but ended up ordering the cereal to go with my coffee. Cereal, seriously. This was the best cereal I've had. This isn't your average cocoa puffs with milk - order it, try it and you'll know what I'm talkin' 'bout. 

Sadly, the coffee (the one with the strange dog name) was not that good. I'll come here again. I'll order the cereal, but I'll have a different coffee.
author: Irina R.

description:
this is the PERFECT spot IF........:

A. you're a millennial with too much money to spend on toast.
B. you have a beard and your hair is a "man bun" (note! if the word MAN is in the title of your coiffure, it's NOT very manly) & a few extra dollars to spend on toast.
C. You're not very hungry and  you feel like spending too much money on toast.
D. the community table - which is the size of the whole restaurant, is the perfect place to meet friends so you can pool your money and spend it all on toast.....


They have other items on the menu that look great but I spent all my money on toast. Next time I'll buy a WHOLE loaf of bread, a dozen eggs, cheese, fruit, and OJ up the street at the Trader Joe's and spend less than I did on .....you guessed it....FARM: TABLE's toast.

Hope this helps!
author: Ducati D.

description: Cute little shop with pretty delicious food. I ordered the salmon toast and I was very delighted. The food is fresh and well prepped. I really loved the outside seating and the view that came with it. This place is extremely small and there is much seating so you might have to just take your food to go and eat somewhere else. Also, it can get really busy. My friends and I got lucky when we came because there were no lines however, that immediately changed after ten minutes.
author: Renzy B.

description: Unique selection of lattes. We ordered matcha chai latte and turmeric golden latte. Both lattes honestly tasted just like steamed milk for $4.50 each. I'm sure other things on the menu are good though, but a little disappointed with the exotic latte names and pretty boring, bland flavor.
author: Sela B.

description:
After a couple of days doing the usual Starbucks run while on vacation - I was hankering for something different and healthy so stumbled upon this place thanks to Yelp

About a 10 minute walk from Union Square; it's a tiny little spot with limited seating but we managed to grab a table outside and enjoy something local!

Service was quick and friendly; the serve yourself coffee was pretty tasty and packed a good punch to start my day! They have pastries which was just right for my carb monster teen but I enjoyed the home made cereal over home made yogurt which had a rhubarb compote and lots of nuts/ seeds / coconut . 

My daughter enjoyed the toast - a thick slick of pain de mir slathered with Mascapone and fresh fruit ; more than enough for two people; and my husband had the egg on croissant 

It's one of those hidden gems with great food to get you started on your day and escape the chain breakfast offerings.
author: Sam P.

description: I got breakfast here today and it was pretty good! I wanted to try the tart of the day but they were sold out. So I ordered what everyone else was ordering and got the house cereal. It was really good but wasn't very filling. I wish I ordered something else with it. The latte was excellent. The only inside table was crowded, so I ate outside. Which was fine because it was a nice day. The service was very friendly.
author: Hannie G.

description:
Breakfast is beyond. All ingredients are fresh, I ordered Salmon Toast with added avocado, and fruit on the side. 
Can be crowded as it is not a big place, but traffic is fast.
author: Christine J.

description:
It's tiny. The sole community table is entertaining. The mini street garden outside was lovely. 

Overall good experience. We enjoyed the fresh fruit but I'd say my Quiche or Savory Tart fell a touch short. The coffee drinks are respectable.

This place may provide a different breakfast session than you are used to. You should go
author: Colin S.

description:
This is our favorite place to grab a quick bite in the mornings. If you can grab a seat at the communal table and eat breakfast with strangers. Nice to see they've added a bit more seating outside but generally we don't expect to sit because it's such a small spot. 

The daily toast is so simple yet delicious. The egg croissant is very good. The drinks warm you right up. The simple charm of this place makes it worth visiting every time we are in the city.
author: Mai H.

description: Great place to grab a quick breakfast. Fresh and fast. Amazing food. I got the breakfast sandwich, which I wish I could get every morning!! The a latte was yummy.
author: Leslie B.

description: Cute.   Small inside but patio seating is comfortable.  Food is good but overpriced.   $20 for a Cappuccino and Salmon toast !!
author: Marty M.

description: I love this place. Food is fresh and tasty, take out packaging environmentally friendly (especially if they get rid of the plastic cutlery) and service is good & fast. Definitely recommended.
author: Hassane S.

description: I made a quick stop here to pick up a sandwich for lunch. There's not a lot of space inside, but I didn't have to wait at all. Friendly service and the egg sandwich was very good.
author: Brena E.

description: This is such a cute LITTLE place! The food was limited but delicious and beautifully presented. Friendly staff and nice ambiance. Be prepared to order to go or sit outside- there is only one table inside. Definitely recommend this place!
author: Christy D.

description:
Well, I just wanted to know if it's worth all the hype. Actually, yes! Super tiny place with a few seating places inside and a few outside, plus a long line of both lanes caps and tourists attracted by high rating of this breakfast spot. 
I fell in love with my Tuna Melt that is not so very popular and always available, as they said. Good for me! I knew they make great coffee, but I went for Matcha Latte and it was above and beyond! Very friendly and sincere people, very quick service (considering the long line!) I was lucky to get a place outside and enjoy my morning reading along with a cup of unmercifully good Matcha Latte while they were making my tuna. 
This spot gets 5 of 5 stars! Honestly, I would give even 6!
author: Katerina S.

description:
Underwhelmed..

The menu and the names of the items are adorbs. What saved this review was the awesome Coffee/Tea/Latte Menu. I tried the Matcha+Chai, the Charcoal Latte, and the Honey Latte. They also have a Nutella Latte among other delectable choices. From the three latte's I tried, I can vehemently endorse the Charcoal Latte which is absolutely "instagram worthy" and downright tasty. 

The food on the other hand was very very underwhelming. I eat a modified vegan diet, so as you can imagine, I did not pick to eat here- my friends did. I made peace with eating butter and such an ordered a croissant sandwich with no meat-- added avocado and veggies. It was seriously bad, the croissant wasn't crispy.. I tried my friend's dishes and they were also just... not good. The food crushed my brunch dreams. 

Also, this place is such a nightmare to get into.. San Francisco has lines out the front of every Brunch place, but the difference is, that some places are worth the wait. I can't say the same for this place. 

Grab a latte and get out.
author: Glory F.

description: Stopped by here because the line at Brenda's Soul Food was ridiculously long. I got the egg croissant which was tasty. It was a bit pricy ($8.95) compared to what I thought it should cost ($6.95), but delicious none the less. My girlfriend got the salmon toast which came with a small side salad and a honey latte. Both of her food items were tasty.
author: Richard L.

description:
I've been walking past farm:table for the past year and finally decided to try it! I got the Salmon Toast and tried a bit of their coffee. 

The Salmon toast tasted quite good. It was very simple and the salmon seemed quite fresh. The only thing is that it's definitely on the pricey side and there isnt much on the toast beside the salmon. For $15, you get a few slices of salmon and 3 slides of toast. Although it tasted good, I can't see myself getting this exact item when I come back.

Beware that the line here can get quite long and that there is very little seating. They have one bigger square table that can sit 8 people or so indoors. The only problem is that you have everyone waiting in line staring at you and watching you while you eat. They have a couple outdoor seating areas too but it may be occupied. I would just be aware that you might have to get to go if you come here.
author: Cassie Z.

description:
This place was good at one time....
When I walk in and see someone in the back on a cell phone and then someone I just passed on the street come back from a smoke break and start making an espresso drink without washing their hands....
Nope not going to order anything from the back or even a coffee. Disappointed to see Starter bakery offered here at first then I realize that might be the safest bet in this place now...
author: Davis M.

description: Great brunch spot but kinda small, get here early in the morning to avoid really long lines. If there is a long line, wait because it does go fairly quick and the breakfast items are all worth the wait.
author: Rabia H.

description: Great place and easy to get to from Union Square. Great vegetarian and vegan options for breakfast. I loved the cozy atmosphere. When it gets busy there's not much room to sit so come prepared to get you breakfast to go.
author: Ramiro S.

description: Got the cereal here and the turmeric latte with soy. Excellent customer service, but I was underwhelmed by the cereal for the price. They do make their yogurt in-house from whole milk, but it wasn't worth the $
author: Chanie H.

description:
After hearing good things about this place from friends, I finally had a chance to try it out.

It was actually very surprising that the Pug n Honey latte was the most delicious item we ordered! From the menu, it said it was a latte sweetened with local honey, but it tasted much more than just honey added. Definitely recommend that!

This spot is SUPER small and has only one table, so you'll have to share it with others.  It was kind of refreshing being "forced" to interact with others (not really though, since everyone was super friendly!).
author: Helen Z.

description: Today's daily toast is huuuuuge!!! Guess they know I v been starving for the whole night. :) lovely and fresh taste.
author: Chun J.

description: Small little cute place in lower Nob Hill. Stumbled upon this place looking for a healthy, light fresh breakfast/brunch. Seating is limited but it was pretty easy to find a place to sit. Such a cute concept. Food was fresh, clean and yummy. Had the Matcha Latte, it was a nice mix. Also had the daily toast and omg it was yummy .  It's seasonal, daily, fruits. Glad to see little places like this around.
author: Hana A.

description: So first off, I don't eat gluten because it makes my stomach upset. But then my husband showed me a picture of their toast...and I ate gluten...and I don't regret it. Yum. Nothing wrong with this toast. Makes all us gluten-enemies dream about gluten.
author: Jasmine C.

description:
Super cute, stylish little cafe! They have a really pretty toast (daily toast) and other breakfast options. The drinks here are also adorable and delicious as well. Would recommend and will be back again for breakfast. 

Note that there isn't much seating here (one large, shared table inside) and a few tables outside.
author: Caley Z.

description:
Really liked the friendly service, good food and the fact that it is so close to the shopping area. Make this your pit stop if you are super early or super late. We had their daily toast which is divine and not too sweet. It is not the most filling if you are a guy so plan to get something else with it or plan to eat soon. The matcha chai latte is also very good but if you're like me, ask for it extra hot. The cappuccino is pretty good as well. All in all, will be back. 

They have limited seating overall and if you are a party of 8 you've probably taken their entire indoor space! Very friendly staff and it is a few blocks away from all the buzz. So next time you want to rejuvenate between shopping stints, hit this place.
author: Connoisseur D.

description:
Food is above average for a cafe but overpriced. Awkward / cramped interior layout but a cute parklet outside.


---- FOOD ----

Croissant with Egg: 4 stars

Bacon Tart: 3.5 stars


---- DRINKS ----

Hot Chocolate with Housemade Almond Milk: 1 star
They use unsweetened dark chocolate but not enough of it. Their house made almond milk tastes slightly sour and I hate to admit that I prefer storebought almond milk.

Hot Chocolate with Regular Milk: ??

Cappuccino: 3.75 stars
On par with Blue Bottle. This is on my partner's strict scale where Saint Frank's / Papa November / Cento, the best in the city, rank at 4.5 stars.
author: Letitia L.

description:
Words can't express my love for their daily toast and turmeric latte. Not only does everything on the menu look ridiculously beautiful it tastes amazing every single time I visit! The toast is perfection: a thick layer of vanilla mascarpone cheese atop a crusty slice of toast topped off with an assortment of fruit of the day. 

The service is also amazing - thanks guys, I appreciate the smiles!
author: Rach K.

description:
Excellent, perfectly proportioned, small menu healthy breakfast place. A jem in the city of greasy diners. Freshly made, locally sourced items... coffee to fruit. You can even see when their cereals were made (dated) and some truly excellent lattes.
A new favorite place to take friends and clients from out of the country who are used to simple, fresh food. You won't find any high fructose corn syrup or nitrates here. Quality instead of quantity.
Thank you guys for the awesome Daily Toast, Pugliscious Latte and charm.
author: Maus M.

description:
I came here to have brunch with one of my friends a month ago and here's the breakdown:

Ambiance: Super casual. There's literally one table inside, two tables outside, two fold down tables with stand-up room, counter seating at the window outside, and parklet seating. I got there early and staked claim on the counter seating by the window outside. We took turns ordering at the counter to keep our seats.

Food: I ordered the Daily Toast. The bread was soft with crisp edges and slightly sweet. The mascarpone cheese was a nice match with the bread and assorted fruits on top. My friend ordered the House Cereal, which looked really good.

Drinks: I ordered a cappuccino, which was pretty good, but nothing out of the ordinary. My friend ordered the Matcha Tea Latte and loved it.

Service: Great, friendly service.
author: Leana L.

description: They do not have options for those allergic to strawberries/nuts as they make everything in the same area so there is bound to be contamination. Sad that all I could have was a cold croissant and hot chocolate, but the cashier let me take the croissant for free since I couldn't have anything else which was nice. My friend loved her salmon toast and matcha chai latte though.
author: Victoria S.

description: The place is run by tablet fascists! Cereal was OK. They have one cramped communal table. I was minding my own business, reading my Kindle when I was told I had to put it away. No electronics policy, they say. I'm just trying to read a book, I say, what's the problem? I got multiple excuses. People steal them! People spill coffee on them! If you want to support control freak hipsters, by all means give them your business.
author: Peter C.

description:
Great location in Union Square area and super quick bite to eat without a long and drawn out wait like the other heinously long brunch lines in the city. Let it be known though that this place is literally a hole in the wall with maybe 6 seats inside and another 7 or so outside. It's no 'sit down and take your time mingling over mimosas' brunch place. Their menu is seemingly busy - written in chalk and overwhelming BUT the reality is that they have maybe 7 options for brunch and all the options are fairly cold. My croissant  sandwich with a boiled egg and avocado add on had a few greens placed inside of it and truly even though was fresh and just good enough - wasn't anything to rave about. It lacked flavor and definitely all the hype. Certainly not a 10$ breakfast sandwich. Having said that, their choccochino (dark chocolate cappuccino) was pretty yum and not overly sweetened, the service was just fine and the lack of a wait was definitely a huge plus for us on a hurried Saturday morning.
Farm:Table, expand your seating space, clean up the messily written menu and cater towards having more hot breakfast/brunch options. Throw in some hot peppers or sauce maybe? 
You may be the winner all the way!
author: Kinjal N.

description:
Great food but a bit overpriced. 3 toasts and 2 coffee was $50. They don't post prices on the menu.


That said the food was excellent!!!!!
author: Clement H.

description: Right out of the gate, kind friendly service. Nothing pretentious, very welcoming. Food was fantastic, fresh ingredients, all of which adds up to somewhere I look forward to visiting in the future.
author: Hollis G.

description:
Meter parking around this neighborhood.

Very little seating outside and its a really small place but there is a large communal table inside. 

I got the daily toast, my friends got the melted tuna and the egg in croissant.

The daily toast was so beautiful and it tasted amazing. It's definitely sweet and for those who have a sweet tooth! (Me :3)

As for drinks, we tried iced coffee (which was super strong), latte (standard), honey latte (sweet and yummy) and the lavender latte (light lavender taste). 

My friends enjoyed theirs as well, the tuna melt tasted pretty standard but the egg in croissant was yummy. 

Cute place, but very tiny! So try to grab a table if you see one (they're mostly outside if you want your own).
author: Melanie T.

description:
Farm table is an absolutely cute place. I came her 30 minutes before closing. Luckily the staff were really friendly and quite accommodating. I feel bad when the restaurant is about to close. But they were quick with preparing the food. 

I got the daily toast and milk & honey. The daily toast was delicious. You can tell the ingredients were fresh. The fruits on the toast depends on which fruit is in season. So I definitely want to come back again. I like how a simple toast is different every time. That what makes this place unique. On the toast they pair the fruits with a mascarpone cheese. This is the first time I had mascarpone cheese and for me it was mind blowing. I never knew cheese can be sweet...haha. 

The milk & honey drink was delicious. It's pretty much a sweet milk. It might be a little too sweet for some people if you don't have a sweet tooth, but for me it was perfect. 

I can't wait to come back again. This time I will try to come earlier that way I can enjoy my food.
author: Christine H.

description: Went here for my last breakfast in SF. Got the daily bread. It had a french cheese on it that tasted like sweet butter. Also had fresh seasonal fruits - , , , , raspberries, blueberries, and walnuts!
author: Brendan A.

description:
During my 5 day stay in San Francisco, I came here twice for Breakfast. The first time, I came right when they opened at 7:30am. Not sure what to expect, I found Farm:table to be a cute little breakfast stop with some great food driven by excellence. The table in farm:table ain't no lie. They only have one small communal table inside, though there is a limited seating area outside.

I had an iced coffee and the avocado egg sandwich. The egg here is actually hardboiled and split in half, but the sandwich was light and delicious. My coworker actually got the brioche toast with assorted fruits which looked amazing, and I knew I had to try it. I came back a few days later and it was probably the best breakfast item i had during my say in San Fran that week.

I will say though that I wish the place was a bit larger. A couple came in asking for scrambled eggs and typical breakfast foods, which this place does not have, but the food that is on their menu is amazing. They also have a selection of various teas.
author: Leon K.

description: My favorite place in San Francisco, I can't go without coming here!! The food is amazing, I can't speak enough about how yummy and fresh everything is
author: Danielle G.

description: Beware they do not post prices anywhere and seemed a bit put out when asked. I get it that the food is fresh from the farm and prices fluctuate, but I believe in transparency. The woman in front of me was shocked to hear what her tab was for coffee and the most minimal toast. Hopefully they've put up a a pricelist since I was last there a few months ago. Food was fresh, had a great presentation, but I've had similar without being overpriced.
author: Jean A.

description: Very small, but size doesn't matter here! Hubby and I were looking around for breakfast in the area and came across farm table on yelp. This place is definitely a little gem! Our drinks and toast were amazing!
author: Khatherine P.

description: If you're looking for a bigger breakfast, this is not your place. I had their toast of the day which was a thick slice of bread, toasted with a mildly sweet topping and a ton of fresh fruit. I really enjoyed mine. My husband had the salmon toast which was topped with smoked salmon and onion (think bagels and lox). He was less impressed with his. We also shared a sweet roll which was nothing amazing. On a side note, you should know that this place is TINY!! It seemed that less than ten people could fit inside and only a small amount of outdoor seething is available.
author: Rebbi B.

description: Small take out breakfast spot. Latte was almost $5 and nothing too special. Limited food options, though they did have gluten free bread for their sandwiches.
author: Ron G.

description:
So tasty! Everything from delicious pastries and sandwiches and fantastic coffee. Most likely you'll have to wait to order and for a seat but it's worth it! 
Definitely something a little off the beaten path but an absolute gem.
author: Jey B.

description:
Great quick breakfast place!
Ordered the daily toast and their breakfast tea.
Sat right by the window at the shared table.
author: Myreen L.

description:
Awe, yeeees! I love their seasonal toast w/ the fruit. I didnt expect the toast be to thick, or to have creme fraiche on it, but definitely loved it. Its also super insta worthy! (I definitely put it on mine). I can't wait until they bring back the dragon fruit seasonal toast!! The toast itself is kind of pricey for a piece of toast, but I think you'll appreciate the local establishment and the work they put into making the toast. 
The people were really nice, and the establishment has nice seating. There is inside and outside seating, but I would recommend the outdoor seating b/c it's a lot more capacious.
Its also very accessible by bus, and has shaves ice a block down. Checkout some toast, and get shaved ice--the whole shebang!
author: Aleex J.

description: Farm:table was just alright - nothing spectacular but not bad at all. I guess I can imagine why this place would be popular... It's basically a small outfit serving up fresh (and admittedly instagrammable) food that you can take to go; and there's coffee too (I didn't try though). So if I were a local then yeah maybe it could be a regular go-to place if convenient, but I wouldn't go out of the way to visit. And anyway fwiw, I tried the egg on croissant and daily toast, neither of which were particularly spectacular.
author: Olivia P.

description: Great little place. Fresh and delicious.  Lots of fresh fruit. Great coffee.  Close to Union squate
author: Maria A. L.

description: Got the daily toast here and it was amazing! It was deliciously sweet. Knocking off a star for being overpriced. $8 for one piece of toast with fruit?!?
author: Jenny J.

description:
Super duper small, cute breakfast place, with very pretty instagram worthy food!

The spot is reallllly small, with one table inside, and outside chairs & tables to sit at. I got the Daily Toast ($7.95). It was a slice of thick, soft, brioche topped with mascarpone cheese, and seasonal fruits. When I went my fruits had blackberries, strawberries, plums, cherries, and peaches. It was then sprinkled with some pecans. The bread was nicely toasted & it held up against all the yummy fruits. Sure, some may say it's just bread with fruit, but it was honestly really delicious. The bread was buttery and pillow-y, & the mascarpone was a good complement and didn't overwhelm the fresh fruit flavors!

They also had other options such as  a croissant sandwich, baked goods, coffees, and teas. The staff was also super nice, brought out our food to us, and it was just a nice welcoming environment. This place is definitely worth a stop by! I would go back to try their other delicious food.
author: Joy W.

description:
Cute!!


This place is tinier than tiny! Like a miniature version of cuteness. And we all know miniature versions are way cuter than full size ones!! #funsize :D

This tiny place has awesome organic and naturally yummy things!! Organic coffee!? Check! Delicious fresh fruits all over toasts, croissant-wich, salad? Yes please!! 

Everything look and smell fantastic! So fanatic I had 2 cups of coffee in half hour! And of course: their daily toast! It's a feast for my eyes and my tastebuds!!! Love the colorful fruit variety!! 

Place is tiny!! Think 4-5 seats tiny but with communal table. Some chairs outside but it is so windy to sit out! They are pretty good about bringing your items anywhere though!! 

And that toast!! Oh so cute and tastyy!!! You got my vote!!
author: Latifa S.

description: Tried the egg on croissant & daily toast. Both were really tasty, toast is a bit messy though. Very limited seating so we had to stand outside. Small menu but the good is quality.
author: Marie C.

description: A rather disappointing eat. Not factoring the long wait, the fact that the inside was super hot, and the lack of space to eat, we took our order to a nearby coffee shop to try the food. The four of us tried the croissant, the toast, and the quiche. The bottom line is the food is nothing special. An average quiche and salad with a mustardy vinaigrette. The croissant consisted of items I could buy and make myself: a croissant, ham, lettuce, and hardboiled egg (not even runny!). The toast was just toast, spread, and fruit. It's a budget-friendly price but I'd rather spend a little more for something more exciting and interesting to eat. Next!
author: Allison S.

description: We went there on a Sunday based on reviews and photos but there were too many people so we decided to go back Monday. Not that thrilled with croissant breakfast with hard boiled egg lettuce and tomato. And only other breakfast dish was cereal. Pretty expensive for that small breakfast and cup of tea and coffee. The hard boiled egg was cold and needed salt pretty bland. So very disappointing
author: Patti B.

description:
They have high quality fresh food that is delicious. However, the location is tiny and literally offers one farm table indoors for seating. Maximum occupancy inside - 12. :) 

They do have outdoor seating but when we went today it was raining.  

If you want a traditional American breakfast - this isn't the place. We were looking for something light and fresh and this place definitely hit the spot. We really enjoyed the Daily Toast. My boyfriend had their unsweetened Hot Chocolate and I had their coffee which was delicious.
author: Jessica A.

description:
I'm completely dumbfounded as to how this place has so many great reviews and why there's a line for this place. If I was rating this place solely for instagrammable content, then yes, 4 stars. But taste-wise so disappointing. Nothing had flavor. 
Daily toast, which was a crunchy plain piece of bread with a cinnamon type butter and some cut up fruit - pretty, but no taste. 
Tuna melt - cheese wasn't even fully melted and the tuna mix had no flavor.
Egg croissant - flavorless. The croissant on its own was the best thing we ate. 
Cafe au lait- subpar
$31 later and I'm full... of regret.

Go to milkbean a couple blocks over instead - trust.
author: I S.

description: Pittsburgher looking for healthy food that wouldn't upset my stomach and doesn't cost a fortune.....and I found it! One of my absolute best meals during my three day stay!! I had the avocado toast, gf bread, with mixed greens for the side. Heavenly! It was filling but didn't weigh me down. My latte with almond milk was delish and was only topped by the incredible waitstaff! Kudos!
author: Heather R.

description: Found this little gem and so glad I did. I ate my gluten free breakfast sandwich and amazing latte. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a great meal.
author: Tfabulous R.

description: Came here on a Saturday morning. Loved the neighborhood vibes this place gives off. Unfortunately, it's becoming too popular for its own good that I think the quality of service and food has been declining. First off, it is extremely warm and stuffy inside where people can eat and wait for their food. It's definitely a grab and go place if anything. I used to love getting this egg biscuit dish, but realized it is no longer available =(  I ordered the salmon toast and for $13.50, I don't think it is worth how much it is priced at. It had at max 3 ingredients on the slice of bread. It was good bread, but all in all not worth the $13.50. In terms of small suggestions, I think if they offer simple but more affordable breakfast sandwiches (with the same great ingredients), and allowed ordering outdoors to allow more grab and go transactions, then it would make a huge difference!
author: Frances P.

description:
Farm:Table is one of my favorite little breakfast spots in the city.  The menu is simple yet everything is tasty.  I ALWAYS go for the breakfast toast.  You think fruit and toast for $8?  This is no ordinary toast.  The toast is thick and delicious with this white creamy spread, topped with the freshest fruit; blood orange, blue berries, and blackberries.  (Fruit varies) So satisfying and surprisingly filling.  Their fresh juice is also a must try, it's a small glass but I love the combo of pear and pineapple.  The Green Matcha tea is a must try.  
The place is tiny, there's one table inside.  Additional seating is offered outside, they have a couple tables, and some counter space to stand next to.  it's definitely more of a grab and go, or eat and leave type of place.  

Overall love the staff, the food, and the variety of teas they offer.
author: Adrianna P.

description: The Daily Toast is where it's at- so fresh and delicious, it's almost too good to be true. The Egg on Croissant is also a great option for something more hearty. Add your favorite espresso drink and I call this a successful breakfast. The only negative about this spot is there's very limited inside but hopefully you can find a spot outside on the street.
author: Grace L.

description:
Farm Table is a cute place to stop for a quick fast bite or if you are willing to wait for a sit down breakfast. But unfortunately cute is the only wining factor here. 

The place is small with rude workers excusing themselves rudely to get by you in this tight little place while you are ordering your breakfast at the counter.

There is literately one communal table inside and a few makeshift seats along a garden type of wooden thing and 3 small round tables.   It seems cute at first but once you try maneuvering your dish and a coffee, it does not seem so cute anymore.

Prices are steep but it is to be expected in the city.  I ordered a fruit toast which is one of the items they are known for.  It consisted of crème fresh on a brioche toast and some seasonal fruit atop.  It was tasty but not memorable enough to come back to.  I also shared a steamed milk drink which was sprinkled with lavender and other spices which was very comforting and delicious.

On top of dealing with the rude staff and cold service, you then are expected to clear your own plates and must place them in the correct bins if you don't want to experience further rudeness.  There are way better options in a city this big to reconsider this eatery.
author: Sylvia Q.

description: Good starting my Friday at this cafe  i do like their fresh croissant wt eggs but matcha chai latte was not as good as i expected. Ill go back to try their toast wt fruits by chance though
author: Tiratiwan L.

description:
Cute little tiny tiny cafe with some seriously good treats. I had always been under assumption before I came that it was a brunch place but it def is not. It's somewhere to get small bites. 

On a warm day I love to sit on one of their benches outside and enjoy their daily toast and sip on some coffee/tea.

The portions are tiny and it's not very cheap; it's not somewhere I personally would go often. 

I would bring friends who haven't tried it back if I'm in the area!
author: Hetal P.

description: I loved the food, service was okay, didn't really get the best vibes, the guy at the counter was kinda a dick and the girls were stuck up. I rock suffer gear and still make solid money yet I felt like anyone they perceived to be clean cut/ have money they treated differently. Appearances can be deceiving. I bet i was one of the highest tipping customers that day. The food was delicious and super excited to go back for the food not so much the company
author: Brandon C.

description:
WoW!!

Sure, it's not cheap but it's well worth every cent!

I had the toast with cheese and fresh fruit and it was amazing!!  The freshly squeezed apple and orange juice didn't disappoint.  It's truly fresh and delicious here!

The only con is the limited seating area on cold days.  It's a popular spot so it pays off to get there early.  The staff is super friendly, and the food is spectacular!  

Must try! Highly recommended!
author: Ana B.

description: Amazing quick breakfast spot! Healthy gluten-free options and friendly staff. Great place and great food.
author: Brooke S.

description: Delicious and fresh. But I do wish that the atmosphere was a little less cramped, and a little more profession towards customers. But overall, the food is what we went for. Gluten free options available.
author: Rebekah R.

description: Terrible service. Guess this place has become so popular that they think they can treat costumors like *. Dogs in the kitchen hand fed by the chef???!. And food really wasn't that great. Brown avocados.
author: Emilie S.

description: Have heard of this place for a while and finally made it here. It's a tiny place so it does feel a little squishy - you basically have to sit outside to eat if you're lucky to find a table. But the food was great! I got a croissant egg and ham sandwich and it was flavorful. Everything else was pretty casual. I'd recommend!
author: Felicia C.

description: Toast was amazing. I really wanted to know how to make the spreads on Daily toast. Flat white was also great. The thing is this cafe is sort of tiny, it's going to be better they have enough space.
author: Mijeong K.

description: A little pricey but really good. Love the egg croissant whatever they are called. The Nutella lattes are good too
author: Shivam P.

description:
My girlfriend and I love Farm Table.  We are regulars that come in at least 3-4 times a week for our coffee/breakfast.  Andrew, Bobby, and Shane are just the best, and make us feel like we are a part of the family.  They always remember our orders with ease.  Andrew is even half filipino, so he's like a cousin, lol.

Great staff and excellent food equates to a 5 star review!
author: Neil C.

description:
This place is across the Marriot on Post, and I was very surprised to see a line out the door every morning - could've sworn it was a Supreme drop. Anyway, I decided to give it a shot and painfully-patiently waited half an hour for a breakfast croissant. 

Sometimes simplicity is everything in the morning, and farm : table mastered it down to an art.
author: Jeff T.

description: I fell in love with this place and their food. I had the daily toast and not only was it delicious it was visually beautiful. My friend had the tuna melt and it was also tasty. The coffee selections were different and delicious. Would recommend this to anyone!
author: Angela R.

description: I had the worst experience ever. First off the cashier was giving me attitude when I was ordering but I ignored it. I was a party of 4 and there was not enough sitting so I pulling 2 chair from another table and when he came out to give us our drinks he said that was rude. He angrily brought out chairs to replace the ones we took, throwing them down. I felt like I was racial profiled and the same employee was yelling at me when I asked for a refund. He made a big scene at told me to get out. When I was crossing the street to leave he kept yelling at me and making comments.
author: Brianna G.

description:
Beware: This  place looks way better than advertised!

The salmon toast was $15 and had hair in it, I was told they have vegan food and they don't. So I got a bowl of fruit and the grapefruit was dry and the blueberries had mold! There are no prices anywhere so for 2 cups of orange juice (the size of only my palm, which was sunny D) a moldy bowl of fruit and a salmon toast with a side of hair in it was $29. Don't waste your time, money, or taste buds on this place people.
author: Ashley G.

description: Delicious and fresh organic food! Salmon toast special and tuna melt are crazy good. The turmeric spiced latte is unique and tasty. Vanilla Pear pastry to die for. Service was amazing and the staff is super friendly-great neighborhood spot. Only indoor seating is a shared table-it was raining when we went but only had to wait a short time to sit. I wish I lived here this would definitely be my on-the-way-to-work coffee and brekkie stop!!! Five stars all the way-keep it up!
author: Michelle S.

description:
One word to sum up my breakfast: Awesome!

Try their Daily toast and Maccha Latte!
author: Shakeel K.

description:
If you need a negative experience and a terrible attitude from the employees and what I believe was the owner or a manager, please visit the place. Honestly I would never expect from a place whose business depends on customers to treats customers like garbage. 
I walked in with a Starbucks cup (not that I owe explanation to anyone but I have really low blood sugar and I usual drink coffee immediately after I wake up to make sure I don't faint) and while I was on a line to order breakfast for four, I was told "really? you are bringing Starbucks to another coffee shop?" , I was also told  with a very demanding and threatening voice "it is a problem but this time I would let it slide". They weren't happy I chose their coffee shop to bring my relatives from Europe to have breakfast EXACTLY AT THEIR PLACE. No! They made a problem about A SINGLE CUP OF COFFEE from another coffee shop. So I was about to spend $50 for breakfast but they got upset I would not spent $50+ $2 for a breakfast with a single coffee. Now that's what I call greediness, rudeness and ignorance! Thank you. I truly appreciate you making my choice for dining easier and shorter.
author: Viktoriya V.

description:
I always use yelp for awesome places to grub and after typing breakfast spots near union square, farm table came up. What really caught my attention was their daily toast, it just looks so delicious with all those fruits on the top. Now im not a coffee drinker but definitely wanted to try something new other juices, so i order the milk anf honey and it was warm and delicious. 

I recommend farm table to anyone visiting san fran
author: Hector H.

description: Had no idea how itty-bitty this cafe was. I was expecting a full size cafe. Regardless, I  was very pleased with the customer service I received and the amazing daily toast i ordered. The daily toast was beautifully made with care and attention. The fruits were fresh and tasty, the mascapone was perfect, and the toast was fluffy on the inside but crispy on the outside. I also ordered their turmeric golden milk latte. It was great. Would def come back!
author: Andrea R.

description:
The diminutive size, with barely enough space for one table, and the prevalence of earthy tones in the interior epitomize the popular notion of a hipster restaurant. 

I ordered the tuna melt and cold press orange juice. The tuna melt was an open face melt with a side salad garnished with vinaigrette. The $8 cost for the tuna melt seemed quite reasonable, and I had qualms about neither the melt nor the salad. In retrospect, however, ordering tuna from an establishment espousing farm-to-table values may not have been that smart, considering that farmed tuna is not necessarily better than wild tuna.

The cold press orange juice tasted like it came straight from Whole Foods. I should have purchased it from the grocer instead of paying $3 for a 10oz cup.
author: Justin S.

description:
Again TINY place.
Came on a Wednesday around noon and disappointingly half the menu was sold out. 
My plan was to order at the counter and sit outside. 
There was noone in line so I go in with a stroller and am immediately asked to leave the stroller outside (sure, I'll just leave my stroller AND baby unattended outside). While carefully making my way outside, admittedly slowly because of the stairs, I'm again told by another employee that I'm blocking the way of the residential entrance right next door. Thanks man, for reminding that having a baby in a stroller is a huge inconvenience to everyone, I think I got the message. I expressed my annoyance at him while he was walking out and he turns around to tell me that I'm being too sensitive. 
Needless to say, not coming back. Maybe the food would have been good but definitely not worth the rude service.
author: J C.

description: These guys are super great, make amazing egg tart (quiche), and they serve a mean matcha latte!
author: Lindsay L.

description: Went here for a quick breakfast before my flight back to NY. We were going to sit there but due to limited seat, we had it to go back to our hotel. I had the smoked salmon toast, which was bigger than I thought, with a side salad. My friend had the croissant, which she said was decent. Expect a wait but since it's pretty small, it's only about 10-15 wait for your food, which isn't so bad with how popular the place is. Not cheap but they do give you enough food.
author: Crystal Y.

description:
I made plans to come here with Nina Y. for our weekly Sunday brunch. It turned out to be pouring rain, but we went anyways. First I thought how nice it would have been to sit outside in sunny weather, but instead I had to pounce on some of the new spots at the bench inside farm:table. This place is tiny! Most people stopping by grabbed a latte and pastry, but we were intent on trying the delicious-looking food.

While I was waiting for Nina to arrive, I ordered a Pug N Honey Latte, which was amazing! Perfectly sweet. Would recommend. We split the Daily Toast and Egg Croissant. Both were so good. The Daily Toast is topped with mascarpone cheese and tons of fresh fruits. Makes an aesthetically pleasing IG photo if I do say so myself... the Egg Croissant was also very filling and tasty. If you're coming with a friend, I would recommend splitting.

The service is excellent. They do a great job at keeping the line flowing. People sitting at the large bench don't seem to stay for hours, so it shouldn't be a long wait for a seat. Would recommend trying to come here during nice weather, ordering food and coffee, and having a seat outside.
author: Stefanie C.

description:
The only reason Im giving it a 4 star is because the place is too small and crowded. Otherwise, it would get 5.
The food and customer service is excellent!
author: Rosangela B.

description:
Farm: table was unfortunately underwhelming. I was expecting the menu options to have more fresh-local produce with a more organic feel as their name suggests, but it was more of a hole-in the wall sandwich place. 

Food:
+Got the tuna-melt open sandwich and egg-ham on brioche (they ran out of croissants by 12pm). Nicely presented but quality/taste was decent. It was definitely overpriced for food (~$8/item) that I could easily make at home. 
+ I liked the Matcha-Chai Soy Latte the best.

Ambiance: 
+There is only one medium sized table that can squeeze 8 people total (2 per side). 
+ It was cold inside as the door was kept open - could have been better insulated especially during winter!

Service:
+Designed so they don't have to provide you any service- the utensils are all laid out on the table and it could have been cleaner
author: Linda K.

description: Found this place on yelp!  Fabulous!  We had salmon toast, egg on croissant, and daily toast.  All amazing!  Very casual, very small with limited seating.  Delicious!  Worth the visit!
author: AM W.

description: Cute little spot by the street! My boyfriend and I got lucky and secured a table and got to enjoy our food while seated. Not a lot of tables around here so be prepared to take your food to go. The toasts and coffee were fantastic! You can taste the freshness of the ingredients. I also had the charcoal latte and it tasted just like a slightly sweetened milk... not what I was expecting. Overall, it was a great experience and i'll definitely be back!
author: Wendy T.

description:
Instagram trap for sure, got a toast and coffee and my bill was $18. The prices aren't listed on the chalk boards so I was shocked when I heard the total. They didnt even bother to use the good thick toast...

Also the place is the size of a shoe, which isn't the worst, but just don't come on a cold or rainy day bc you probably wont have anywhere to wait indoors for your food.
author: Desiree R.

description: They make their own almond milk! Enough said. Food was amazing (kale salad, toast with fresh fruit and savory tart). Customer service was great. Everyone had a smile. Will definitely be back!
author: Christeen M.

description: We ordered the oatmeal and toast of the day. Everything was good. The oatmeal by itself didn't have much flavor. Needed more toppings. Coffee and turmeric lattes are great.
author: Kirsty V.

description:
Seems like it'd be nice -- but just over-priced and carelessly slopped together food with no concern for taste.

'Super salad' tastes like straight grass.

'Fresh-pressed' juice comes from a carton.
author: Derek O.

description:
This is what you should expect before coming here:

- There is only one table inside to share among all the customers. The table can fit about 8 people all around. If you plan on dining in, you must arrive early. We arrived about five minutes before open time during a non-busy week day and we were the first customers. A few more customers trickled in shortly after. There are seats outdoor as well but not a whole lot.
- Portions are tiny. I ordered the Empanada which suppose to be a meal but the portion resembles half an appetizer. I ended up adding a ham and egg croissant to my order which toppled my breakfast bill over the $20 mark (tip included). To be fair though, the food here is locally sourced so it makes the price a bit higher. 

The overall experience was good. Everyone had a good time and enjoyed their meal. Two out of the four people in my group ordered an extra meal because of how small the portion is for the Empanada. You should just know what to expect before coming here. Its not filling unless you don't eat much and don't care about protein intake as much either.

I recommend ordering the toast with fruit on it (Daily Toast).
author: Danny L.

description: Love the toast of the day and the lavender mocha! The lack of space is rather annoying, but luckily I live a few buildings down and can eat at home. I wouldn't want to eat inside because I'm a bit claustrophobic and the outside seating is usually taken.
author: Meghan H.

description:
If you want a true San Francisco experience, farm : table is THE place to go. 

Loooooong wait. 
+ So long in fact that all 3 of the times I've been here (all before 10:30am), by the time I got to the point in line where I was actually in the building, they were already out of over half the menu. 

Tiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiny space. 
+ There's room inside for about negative 3 people in here. Ok... maybe comfortably 5 total customers, though when we went there were 7 customers inside (I'm including the line people) and it was crazy cramped and I felt like we were all just breathing down each others neck. 

It's priiiiiiiiiiiicy.
+ But it is good and I want to assume it's all quality ingredients and that they bake everything in house since they run out so quickly. 

Service is mehhhhhh.
+ You just order at the counter and it's not a long interaction but for a place that has quite a few coffee drinks with strange names and no descriptions, you'd think they'd either be a little less non-plussed when people asked them questions or maybe just add some ingredients or detials about the drink to their menu.

Small portions, considerable price tag. 
+ Aaah San Francisco style plates. If you're looking for a lighter portion, this is great. If you're looking to have the hearty breakfast your midwestern heart is used to, well... maybe order one of everything because these orders come equal to or less than the portion size of a Hot Pocket. 

I'm not in LOVE with farm : table but friends keep dragging me back 'because it's quick and easy' (it never is) and they have something for everyone (if you get there 10 minutes before they open so they haven't run out) but I have enjoyed everything I've tried and I really do like their coffee beverage menu even if I never know what I'm ordering.
author: Candice G.

description:
I've passed by farm : table a number of times before finally coming to this small joint with two friends last week for Sunday brunch. They have a small menu, but it's consistent and fresh. 

Despite its size, farm : table makes it work. It has a hip vibe. While there were no lines running out the door when we visited, it was a pretty bustling Sunday. They have a bench/table inside that could probably squeeze at most 5-6 but have more seating available outdoors--some small patio tables, a few bar stools along the ledge, a standing table, and a wooden terrace/garden area for sitting. 

We ordered two savory tarts--one with broccoli and bacon and the other with tomato and spinach-- and the egg on croissant. At first, I read the menu and had no idea what a "savory tart" was. They're just slices of quiche. The tarts and croissant were decent, nothing super crazy or special. 

If you're looking for a quick, morning/afternoon bite, check this place out.
author: Christine T.

description: This had to have been one of the best breakfasts I have had in a while! It's a cute small place with a different verity of coffee and food items. The menu is small and all items are healthy! The service was outstanding and the staff was extremely friendly. The food was to die for!
author: Janessa S.

description:
This place is an exceptional little spot in The City that I stumbled upon after a long grueling day dealing with Passport issues. I came in there with a "Phil'z Coffee" cup(I had forgotten Phil'z only does brew, no specialty drinks and the barista there still managed to royally F it up lol), and the owner himself looks at me and goes "what the hell is that Doin in here? Do you like that coffee?"
I said, "no it's actually really bad, could I get some of yours?" And he walked over with a trash can for me, and then proceeded to take my order.
Needless to say, the espresso there is perfect along with the baristas he has working there and THE FOOD
GORL. The food. Oh my god it's delicious. On top of that, the spot he's got for his little café has great scenery of the city and a cool spot to chill out front. I highly recommend this place for anyone walking around the city. The owner is hilarious and so fun to interact with!
author: Birdie B.

description: Amazing food, had the everyday toast and it was delicious! Great place for breakfast.
author: Marjorie G.

description: So I don't know why this place is so highly rated. Our egg croissant tasted good but was nothing special. Coffee is fine but again nothing special. It's a tiny place that does all its cooking out of a toaster oven with paper baskets. The kitchen looked dirty cashier handled cash than someone's food without washing her hands. Super disorganized. I wouldn't bother eating here again. So many other great spots in SF. I gave an extra star because the bakery item was very good!
author: Jessica M.

description:
Love this place! It's cute, quaint, and inviting. Although a really small place, they have an outdoor area with seating in the front, and on a nice day, it's definitely the place to be. They are super friendly and hospitable! You order and go sit down, they bring you your food when it's ready. Overall great experience.
The food is fresh and just so yummy. I tried their lavender latte (they make the syrup in house with real lavender flowers) - it was light and sweet. Great for a treat. Their 'daily toast' was fluffy, crisp, mildly sweet and full of flavor. This was also a nice treat... It's going to be a regular spot for me for sure!
author: Jenna M.

description: I had to stop halfway through my egg on croissant sandwich to write about HOW GOOD this charming quaint spot is!! Sure it's small but I think it adds to the charm. So incredible. I appreciate the care they take in the flavor and quality of the ingredients. Cheers!
author: Renee S.

description:
So Farm:Table is all about the F Bombs. LOL

I don't know how many times I heard an employee curse while I sat and ate my tuna melt. 

My sandwich was really tasty however I was surprised it was literally just one slice of bread. I knew that it would be served open faced I just assumed I would get two slices. Isn't that the norm? At least it is at Crepevine ‍

I'm not sure if there was some emergency spill situation in the "kitchen" area but they decided to mop the floor with pine sol almost immediately after I got my food. You know that smell/taste phenomenon? I'm highly sensitive to it. The scent hit me so hard all I could do was taste cleaner for like 2 minutes. It was not pleasant.

I also feel like they need to do something better with the chalk menu. The coffee/drinks was clear and easy to read but it isn't on the food side. If I had not studied the menu online before I got there I think I would have been rather confused especially because they don't even have any paper menus. Its just sloppy in my opinion. A girl next to me had something that looked delicious but I didn't see anything that described it on the menu. Hmmm?
author: M E.

description:
Pros: Dope place, dope place. Coffee's great, food's great. Oh, and when the employee with a red beanie and eyes so blue you need a road map to get out of 'em asks me how I'm doing, his kindness cuts through space and time. And when his colleague -- the young man who wears black sweats and seems like he could learn to love me in spite of my human tail -- pours just the right amount of coffee into my cup, I often weep.  

Cons: No alcohol, so I have to spike the drink myself to really get my day started.
author: Cliff M.

description: Love the daily toast. As visually pleasing as it is appetizing. Though the place has a small menu, you won't be needing much more. With a great vibe and outdoor seating among the city buildings, this small shop provides a relaxing environment to enjoy your morning meal.
author: W V.

description: Cute place for a light breakfast.  The daily toast was really fun, as it had cinnamon mascarpone and delicious fruit. The salmon was delicious and has a delightful slickness to it. They have cool drinks like charcoal or beet lattes and the best almond milk. Loved it!
author: Esther B.

description:
In a world of greasy, heavy, fatty brunches with huge portions, I loved going to this place with just a few fresh, handmade dishes made with fresh, seasonal ingredients. There aren't many seats: some communal seats inside, a couple of tiny tables outside and a public bench thing - so grab one if you can! There will almost definitely be a long line if you go during brunch hours, but on a nice morning it's not too bad to wait... maybe make a point to get coffee first on your way! 

The most memorable thing I had was the toast of the day, which was absolutely loaded with colorful, beautiful fruit - and we're talking zero filler fruits here! I'm not usually one to go for the sweet breakfast choice, but this was more fresh than sweet, and perfectly satisfying along with my coffee. It was like a work of art and I felt healthy and happy after eating it! 

Go early, bring coffee, prepare for the worst when it comes to waiting/grabbing tables... and the best when it comes to the food :)
author: Christina P.

description:
Not what I expected. I've had this place on my bookmarks for weeks and was finally able to stop by during brunch time on a Saturday morning. 

This place is super small and I mean super small. It's right next to an apartment building entrance and I bet they hate the foot traffic this place brings. It has two small round tables for outdoor seating and ONE single table inside that seats about 8. It's a neat idea to meet new people, cause there is no real privacy in conversations. 

There was a line out the door when we arrived (I always take this to be a good sign) and there was no seating available. My fiancé stood outside and scouted a table while I ordered. 

They have a limited menu- 4 items. I had the famous toast and my fiancé had the ham/egg sandwich. While we waited for our food, about 10 people walked up and left after realizing the wait and small space. 

The toast: it's a thick slice of bread with delicious fresh fruit. It was more like a dessert toast than brunch. I really liked it, but not loved it. 

My fiancé enjoyed his ham egg sandwich, but commented it wasn't anything mind blowing. 

I love the concept of farm to table and felt better eating consciences food. 

I'm gonna be honest- this place needs to move to a bigger spot. Seeing how well they are doing, I hope they can soon.
author: Ceecee M.

description: My husband and I thought we would try this place for breakfast during our visit to San Francisco.  While the food was good, it is not all made in house and varies day to day.  We attempted to order a Savory tart "vegan", which we had seen from another review.  Apparently, they did not have a vegan savory tart and were unable to take off the cheddar cheese when ordering, because they were remade and sent to Farm:Table in the morning.  If you are vegan, there are other options such as cereal, oatmeal and salad..etc.  Seating is extremely limited and the line can be very long.  My advise would be to go early!
author: Paula S.

description: This place is stunning! The manger Christian was beyond courteous and made sure everything was to our liking. You can't beat the view.  We had the Avocado pizza delish and the Paella which was so good! The drinks were cool and refreshing, so was dessert. It gets busy understandably so just like most places on Sobe, service can be bit slower. I'm ok with that in this outdoor environment. All in all making it a regular spot.
author: Dyan C.

description: Best part of staying in this part of town. Great coffee and a delicious breakfast sandwich that I could eat almost everyday.
author: Elizabeth E.

description: My friends and I ordered the daily toast which was delicious! Huge piece of Texas toast with fruit on it and yummy spread. We both ordered lattes and they were delicious as well, however, there couldn't have been any caffeine in them because we were still sleepy an hour later. Service was great, the space is very small on the inside but they have cute tables outside. I'd go back but would I pay $8 for fruit on task ummmmm prolly not. I'll make it at home and give this place another try.
author: Easence F.

description: Had the savory tart with bacon. It was absolutely delicious. It came on a bed of mixed greens in a light balsamic dressing. The only downside is that I. And here's for brunch and they were out of their cold pressed apple juice :(. But it was a great, tasty, healthy option for breakfast/brunch in SF.
author: Jon U.

description:
What a lovely place! It's very small inside and you go to the counter to order, then they will give you a numbered sign. There's a couple places to sit inside and a few tables outside - plus these neat wooden steps with potted plants!! 

I got a croissant sandwich with ham, cheese, and a hard-boiled egg cut in half and placed inside the sandwich. It was small and almost $8 but worth it because this is Union Square, the place is cute, and it was super tasty!!! My mouth was happy. 

Then for under $5 you can get a lavender latte. GET THIS LATTE. The lavender taste is not strong but it is there and delicious.
author: Nicole H.

description:
Love this little spot in my neighborhood. And when I say little, I really mean little.

They have one communal table that can seat maybe 6 people? And a few seats outside which is nice when the weather allows for it.

The one thing that keeps me coming back here is their MATCHA CHAI LATTE. It is the perfect blend of those 2 drinks and just a taaaad sweet. It's a must try!
author: Sue C.

description: Nice place for a quick bite and a hot drink. Menu is small but food was good and quick. Space with chairs to have a seat.
author: Cristopher V.

description:
Gotta try their $8 Everyday Toast!  

Toasted brioche, spread with mascarpone cheese, topped with FRESH seasonal fruit and pistachios. All the components of the toast were delicious together. WELL, I say, it's totally worth the $8.00. If I had not been full that day, I wouldn't have shared ;) 

Sheer delight. 

+ Small venue, so grab n' go
+ Farm to table. Self-explanatory
author: Merica S.

description: I have not posted on Yelp in a while (like three years) as it became a social media battleground to influence traffic , but I felt compelled to post something about this place. Their menu is extremely well thought out, from the egg sandwich to all the various iterations of croissants, it literally is a special place to try. It is disjointed and unorganized so to speak (just a small and busy place) but the food is simply amazing. The egg sandwich is to die for. Yes they are a FTT place and have all that "oodle" that goes with FTT but the food, they nail it, out of the park and into the ocean. Oh and the coffee.. wow. That one requires a separate post. Thank you for giving an authentic breakfast experience with great food.
author: Andy P.

description:
Cute, and delicious, but SOOOOO overpriced!
The staff is really nice!
I had the salmon toast and Nutella latte, both tasty.
author: Huma S.

description:
DO NOT EAT HERE, THE FOOD MAY BE HEALTH CONSCIOUS BUT THE ENERGY IS SO NEGATIVE!!!! 

My friend and I were looking for a healthier, organic spot to grab some tea and food on our way traveling through San Francisco. Found this place on Yelp and it had pretty good reviews and seemed to be the kind of cafe with super healthy food, which usually means the energy of the place is on a higher vibe...

Walked in around 10am and was not greeted but more like glared at by a shorter, older man with a red beanie, blue eyes and grey facial hair. He hesitantly took my order while rushing me through it like I was inconveniencing him. He put the order in then said "okay I'll bring the rest out to you" and just got on his cell phone. My friend said "I still need to order." He sighed, put the phone down and said "I don't want anybody to order today." I said "so you don't want to make any money?" He said "I'm not run by money, honey" and obnoxiously took her order. 

I don't know if he's the owner or the manager or the cashier and didn't catch his name because his energy was so toxic and negative we didn't stay long enough to. We walked outside to wait for our order and looked at each other like "did that really just happen?" It was so rude and off putting I would never recommend this place to anyone!!! When he brought our drinks out, my friend said "good luck with the rest of your day" and he said sarcastically "really? Do you really think I need luck? I think I'm good, I think I'll be just fine." We grabbed our stuff and got the hell out of there.....

What kind of employee, manager or owner would ever treat paying customers that way? And if you aren't run by money why are you working there?
author: Sammy B.

description: Absolutely loved it. The barista recommended the Nutella latte and it did not disappoint. The daily toast was far better than expected. I'm a picky eater and at first I was hesitant, but honestly it couldn't have been better. The brioche was perfectly toasted, there wasn't too much marscapone, and the fruit was fresh and delicious. I'm already wishing I had a farm : table back home.
author: Dani W.

description: Finally got to try this place and I'm now a fan, especially with their mascarpone cheese spread. It wasn't too heavy or sweet. Just a perfect combo. I order the daily toast which is toasted brioche, spread with mascarpone cheese, topped with seasonal fruit. Yum! It's huge. Small indoor sitting and a few outdoor tables and seats as well. The coffee was not bad as well, big cup. A very cute place to have coffee and breakfast. Staff was great.
author: Sandy B.

description:
This hidden gem and hole-in-the-wall hipster brunch spot is located a couple blocks west of Union Square. While it isn't big with only a communal table inside, there is a good amount of outdoor seating with vibrant green plants. 

I've had this place marked down for a while, and I stopped by Saturday morning around 11:30. I waited in a relatively short line and placed my order wih the friendly staff at the counter, then I went outside to find seating as I felt it was a little stuffy inside. I ordered the matcha chai latte and daily toast. 

The latte art was on point, and the warm drink was perfect for a crisp and slightly cold morning. My caffeine tolerance is basically nonexistent, so the caffeine hit hard afterward, but it was totally worth it for this beautiful blend of matcha and chai. 

The daily toast is definitely Instagram worthy, with a colorful array of fresh fruit on top of a mascarpone spread slice of toast. I had orange, blackberries, figs, two kinds of apple, grapes, dragonfruit, and some walnuts on my toast. I loved the colors and the flavors; everything was balanced, delicious, and filling.

I left feeling healthy and full, which was a refreshing change from the bloated feeling I usually get after brunch, and ready for a day filled with shopping. I highly recommend stopping by and starting your day at farm : table!
author: Lily K.

description:
I stumbled upon this place before a job interview and it was wonderful. 

The place itself is tiny and literally has one big farm table inside. I love this concept because it allows you to sit among other people; sort of like a sit down dinner with your family but with strangers. I don't recommend this place for big groups unless you plan on ordering to-go. 

Their toast with fruit and marscapone was delightfully delicious, not to mention light yet filling.
author: Elisza T.

description:
Came here with a friend not knowing it was more of a breakfast/ brunch place. It's pretty small inside but luckily when I came all the seats were available and it was not busy at all. 

I ordered the egg toast and it was delicious!! It seemed like a really small portion but it was actually filling and really beautifully presented. 

The staff was also really friendly and upbeat and had positive attitudes which made this place have a good vibe. 

Overall I stumbled upon this hidden gem by accident and was lucky enough to come at a time when it was not busy. Their food was good and the employees attitude made me like this place even more. Will definitely be back if I'm in the area :)
author: Amanda R.

description:
Adorable, fresh and yummy!

This tiny little cafe is seriously a gem. I swear they have a secret!

You must order the daily toast which comes with FRESH fruit. The Mascarpone spread definitely made this toast more amazing. 

I also really like the egg croissant sandwich. Not sure what made this basic sandwich amazing... but it definitely wasn't like any ordinary egg sandwich.

The milk and honey was amazing as well! Not sure what kind of spice they added to this drink, but it was goodd...

However, I thought their house coffee here was a bit weird.. it was super sour and it wasn't my taste at all T_T.

All in all, I really enjoyed this place and I'd definitely be back! :)
author: Leilani Y.

description: Yum! A really small spot, so definitely a lot better to do to go from this. I came here because my friend lives across the street. We ran across on a rainy Sunday morning and I got the green tea latte and the eggs on a croissant. It was delicious and savory and decently priced!
author: Nicole Y.

description:
Great place to have brunch! But be aware of small seating area!
Tried their croque royale and green tea chai latte, they offer croque royale only every other week sunday, so if you visit there in sunday and see thay menu, please go try it!
author: Sunmin C.

description: Not only was the vegetarian egg on croissant sandwich delicious- the atmosphere was great! There is one small community table in this little place and I ended up meeting some cool people and having a nice time.
author: Monica T.

description: I had the daily toast as a light lunch. I seriously could eat the mascarpone cheese straight. Hot tea was great on a chilly San Fran day
author: Julie S.

description:
Other reviews didn't depict it well for me- place is extremely small, u order at re counter - it's not a sit down n order place.  I felt like I was on Wall Street, they weren't very friendly and rushed every step of the way, the guy even asked us to leave our table before we were finished and it was still 5mn before closing time, and 15mn before that they took the napkins n condiments off our table to rush us....

I went because I wanted organic eggs and coffee - food was ok, very simple, hard boiled egg smashed up on some bread with lettuce.
author: Maria W.

description: Very inventive and delicious food.  Walked a few blocks to get here and am really happy I did.  The outside patio was definitely a plus and good for people watching.
author: m s.

description:
After reading all the positive reviews for Farm: Table, we decided to give it a shot while traveling to San Fransisco. 
The place is a tiny hole in the wall, the menu is very limited, and there is very limited seating.. Limited to a large picnic bench inside and three tables outside on the sidewalk.
