Small, cute brunch spot. There's real limited seating here and small menu. The food's good, but pretty simple and could probably be made easily at home. Small portions for the price, but a healthy/reasonable portion size.

My friend and I shared an EGG SANDWICH and a DAILY TOAST. The fruit and toppings on the daily toast change. Ours had mascarpone, nectarines, strawberries and pistachios. I really enjoyed it, but had to scrape off some of the mascarpone spread because it was too creamy. The egg sandwich was good too. I thought it was going to come in a croissant like the other reviews said, but ours came on a slice of bread. The bread was good though!

We actually found a hair inside of our bread, which was gross, but the owner was really apologetic about it even though they get their bread from a bakery so it wasn't their fault. And he refunded our entire meal and even asked us if we wanted anything else.

I'd come back for a quick, light brunch :)
author: Jessie L.

description:
Loved the overall brunch experience here! On a Sunday afternoon, I had the savory tart with broccoli ham fennel cheese and onion and tried the daily toast with seasonal fruits. The savory tart, basically a quiche, was pretty good and came with a side salad. Portions were a little small, but fitting considering the prices. But the daily toast was BOMB. Apparently thats what everyone comes here to try, and it was definitely worth making the trip over to try.

This place also has a good selection of coffees and teas. The best part of the experience here is probably the outside seating. It was a nice day, so we got to enjoy the weather in a cute part of SF. And in addition to the tables/chairs, there's also outdoor seating fixtures along the sidewalk that seemed to work well for groups.
author: Julie L.

description:
This place is tiny! Literally a hole in the wall. While the food is a bit pricey, I thought it was simple, quick, and tasty. I went here with a few friends on the weekend for a late lunch and got the everyday toast (mascarpone with seasonal berries/fruit) and a latte. It wasn't AMAZING but it was good enough that I enjoyed it. 

The rest of the crew got the egg croissant sandwich, and while they weren't raving about it, they thought it was pretty good. Service was super friendly, didn't get to talk to them much even though we were the only ones in during the late afternoon. 

I'd come back here again if I was in the area and wanted a simple breakfast/lunch!
author: Shannon N.

description:
I'm glad yelp introduced me to this place. It was very close to our hotel in San Francisco. We headed here for breakfast this morning, and I had one of the tastiest and freshest breakfast sandwiches I've ever had. The croissant with ham, egg and cheese was absolutely delicious. They have a limited menu, but everything looks delicious.

My husband had yogurt with breakfast cereal. It tasted superhealthy and was perfect for his upset stomach. I also had the milk and honey drink with their almond milk. It was an excellent choice.

The venue is tiny, like many places I've noticed in the city of San Francisco. There is very limited seating, but people get creative with where they sit outside. We sat at a small communal table indoors, and it was just fine.

I highly recommend this place for freshness and health.
author: Taj K.

description: Absolutely delicious! The most buttery, flaky croissant with fabulous avocado. I was very impressed by their peppy attitude and enjoyed my time here.
author: Kelley S.

description:
Small busy cafe. 

I ordered the daily toast, it was pretty good. Go ahead and ordered it you won't regret it. A very fresh and light way to start of your day. Don't come here if you're extremely hungry. Yes, the toast is huge but very light. The spread on the toast was delicious. 

We also ordered coffee a cappuccino and macchiato. They were alright, not bad but nothing special. 

It took us a while to wait for someone to leave to get a seat. There is only 1 table inside which fits about 8 people which was full. Outside there were a few seating options but not much at all. We seat outside at a little table on its own. Be careful of when you place your food and coffee on the table. It is a very light table my friend barely hit it with her leg....and we definitely had coffee everywhere within the minute of sitting there. 

You may not be able to find anywhere to sit but I would highly suggest to just take your food to go and take it with you to a park instead. 

Great to stop by once to see what it's all about. It took a while for us to order and get our food. The daily toast was great but the wait and seating issues wasn't worth it.
author: Batul A.

description:
Good place for a grab-and-go breakfast, or if you are looking for something casual, fast, and not too crowded. This is a nice place for a casual SF brunch without the crazy lines. Note there is limited seating (especially indoors), but the outside public parklet is pretty nice on a sunny day.

Food is fresh and fast, with sweet options like the daily toast (fruit on toast) and savory options like the egg sandwich (scrambled eggs on a croissant). There's also fast and fresh drink options available and a counter of pretty delicious pastries.

Prices are on the high side for what you're getting (simple brunch food), but everything tastes pretty great and is served really fast. Great for satisfying your "brunch food" cravings.
author: Brittany C.

description: This place is tiny :) it has one communal table inside that seats about 8 total people plus a few small tables outside. You order your meal and then you get a number if you are eating there and then you have to wait for a seat to open up. We got our meal to go and ate at our hotel lobby since it was raining and didn't want to sit at the outdoor tables. The Egg on Croissant was quite delicious!
author: Steph S.

description: I came to this place a couple of years ago, and wanted to come back on this trip. It's a small place but delicious, everything is fresh and organic.
author: Elizabeth C.

description: Food was great, but even more so was the awesome, friendly customer service. We had our two little ones with us and the staff was so attentive to that and so friendly to our little family. The toast with fresh fruit and mascarpone cheese was OMG.
author: Tonimarie C.

description:
Cute & hip lil' place to grab a bite! And by lil', I mean it.....this place has a few spots to sit inside, otherwise you'll have to try your luck with the few outdoor/sidewalk seating spots. 

We came in at an off-time on a weekday, so no wait! Woot! The service and servers were great and attentive. We ordered the ever-so-popular Daily Toast and also an Egg Croissant sandwich to share. Both were delicious!! Not the most filling, so it was a bit pricey considering that, but definitely taste/presentation-worthy!
author: Melinda W.

description:
My friend and I wanted to try a cute breakfast place while in SF and we found this.  It was such a cute little place.  One square table in the middle of the room that sat around 8 people.  Some outside seats too but it was pouring rain while we were there.  

Its an eclectic menu.  I had the empanada which came with salad.  Both items were really tasty.  The empanada had good filing of beans, meat, veggies.  The salad had persimmons on it.  Yum!  My friend had the breakfast pie which was basically a quiche.  Hers came with salad too.  Looks like it had lots of good stuff in.

For drinks, I had a chai latte with homemade almond milk.  It was really tasty.  Nice and spicy.  Not quite warm enough though.  My friend had coffee.  

Definitely a great little neighborhood place.  Hard to eat there but its fun if you can get a seat.  Those of us at the big table talked about the weather since it was pouring rain outside.
author: Karen C.

description:
What a cute and small cafe shop!

Do get their homely chai tea latte and make it a delicious combo with their daily toast or quiche!  

Their daily toast looks wonderful and it changes everyday so you don't know what toppings they are going to be putting up next! 

You can't go wrong with quiche!  Their quiche is yummy and complimented well with the chai latte or coffee if you were to have coffee with it!  They also have other pastries, but the daily toast and quiche would be on my top choices to get!

It's a great spot to just chill at, grab a small bite with a cup of coffee or chai tea and enjoy!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Such an adorable place to stop for a coffee and toast!

It is a bit cramped - there is one family table inside that you can share with other diners, two small tables outside, and a parklet right across the sidewalk. There is a full coffee menu, a few teas, and breakfast items. They have a quiche, a croissant sandwich (with avocado, cheese, meat, and a hardboiled egg!), house cereal with granola and homemade yogurt, and their daily toast.

THE DAILY TOAST - believe me, you will want to order one just to take a photo of it. Usually its toasted brioche or some other type of bread that's topped with sweetened marscapone and seasonal fruits, sprinkled with crushed pistachios. They arrange the fruit so beautifully you won't want to eat it, but then you take a bite and go all in. SOOO GOOD. 

5/5 would do again
author: Jenny W.

description: Very quaint and fun and tasty.   Great small (tiny) shop atmosphere with a single 5-6 seat table.  Makes for a great social atmosphere with meeting happy strangers and great tasting niche breakfast food. Very high quality and attention to detail.  The owner popped in when it opened and had her pug dog with her.  He was the social attention and also the dog behind the photo on the wall.  The staff is super happy and friendly.  A good blend of culture and tasty food and atmosphere all in one tiny spot.
author: Ron Z.

description: Didn't realize this is a casual dining resturant with very limited seating when I initially went. Also didn't realize the extremely limited menu. I got the daily toast and it was VERY good! My husband got the egg/croissant and it was just okay. If you are looking to grab a quick bite and don't mind eating while standing try the daily toast.
author: Asma w.

description: I came all the way from Vegas to try this place and I'm very disappointed. Not only the service was really bad. The food wasn't all that great either. I asked the person taking the order to please make my food a little extra presentable so I can post it up on yelp. He gave me attitude and said we are always presentable. And on top of that I ordered a green tea matcha. He brought it out with no design at all. I asked him why he said we are busy that's why. I told him it's okay I will wait for the design so I can take a nice picture. He brought out a tea 10mins later didn't even have any designs on it. And dropped it on my table. I get it places get busy but realistically I've already mentioned I came to visit for the first time and they couldn't even give me any service. Very disappointed not coming again.
author: Lily W.

description: This place is great for what it is.  It's a small cozy joint to grab a coffee and quick fresh local bite with a warm but city vibe. The menu is uber limited but I think that's the idea.  They have one table inside that usually a few people share and a few places to sit outside.  If you are looking for a full breakfast/brunch spot where people serve you this isn't the spot.  If you are looking to catch up with a friend over coffee and some light fare this place is perfect.  It's also perfect if you want to get out for breakfast but don't have a ton of time
author: Kristi R.

description: Really tasty, a bit expensive though. Only had a small bowl of cereal and a cup of tea and it was 15$
author: Fanny M.

description: This place is very tiny and it was very packed! Luckily my boyfriend and I were able to get a table for two in front. My quiche was very tasty but we were short on time so we had just a quick bite to eat. The menu had very little to choose from so I wish we had more time to maybe try and taste all of them :) The food is plated so nicely!
author: Jaclyn M.

description:
This place is a gem in Nob Hill. Very tiny with the perfect selection of limited options. We stood outside as we ate over a ledge but that only gave this place more character. 

The Toast of the Day - salty toast with marscapone and a wonderful selection of fresh fruit. AMAZING and will be back for this one. 

Egg Croissant Sandwich - SO delicious and creamy and the croissant was flaky, buttery and incredible. Would definitely recommend!

The Spinach Frittata - this was the only thing I wouldn't order again. It was lacking flavor and wasn't very impressive. 

The coffee is amazing as well!
author: Erica C.

description: I use to live across the street and would frequent the cafe! The staff is amazing!!! The Daily Toast is bomb!! Great for a quick breakfast!
author: Richard H.

description: Their almond milk lattes are so yummy! I had one of their specialty tarts along side, and it was delicious! I was only in San Fransisco for the day, and I was not disappointed
author: Kelsey W.

description: This is a good place for a chilled brunch. Sit on the streets and enjoy nob hill. The food is really good, but it's not so cheap. I would say ££. It is worth it. Cheese cake is good (:
author: Rafael M.

description:
What I got:
Egg Croissant

What I thought:
A really cool small hole in the wall place to grab a quick brunch without having to wait so long. The menu is tiny, so it wasn't too hard to make a decision on what I wanted to eat for breakfast.

The egg croissant was an excellent choice. The croissant itself was toasted to perfection and also golden and flaky -- just the way I like it! The greens were vibrant green and fresh. Ham and egg were on point and definitely activated my drool game with that first bite!

It's a pretty tiny sandwich, but great to grab on the go! farm:table is a small joint as well and there aren't many seats or real estate so it's great if you just want to grab something fast and delicious!
author: Tony V.

description:
What happened too all those unique, creative dishes they used to have? Now they mainly serve cereal, quiches, and croissant sandwiches. Apparently one of the best things here is the daily toast. Really? I can make a daily toast at home. 

The coffee options are still solid though. 

I want the pork stews, the roast pork, and the braised pork with poached eggs and/or brioche back. Which days do they serve those? Can I sign up on a mailing list to be notified?
author: Audrey L.

description: Where do you go in San Francisco for fancy toast and a latte for breakfast? farm:table. This place is super freakin' cute. A small spot with seating outside and a big table on the inside, as well. I ordered the daily toast with a matcha latte. The toast was delicious and so pretty. It was pretty to the point you didn't want to take a bite because it would just mess it all up. But I did... and I ate it all. My matcha latte was delicious and pretty, as well. I did try the milk and honey -- that was really freakin' good too. I also took one of their pastries to-go for my boo and for a guy who doesn't eat breakfast -- he sure did tear that up when I handed it to him.
author: Sarath P.

description: WAY over priced!!! $28.00 for 2 half sandwiches and two 4 oz. lemonades! I asked the staff if the price was correct and the guy said with the most smug attitude ever, "That's San Francisco for ya!" On top of that, they were closing in 25 min so they said we couldn't eat inside and had to take the food to go. They didn't even give us napkins or utensils to go and there were still other guests inside eating!!! Do NOT eat here! The owner needs to get a grip on his workers that are rude to guests and act entitled!
author: Katie B.

description: Good local nob hill / tl standby for a quick brunch. I hesitate to add to the thousands of great reviews that will just make it more crowded. The public parklet in front is nice to sit in the sun and enjoy your coffee on a weekday.
author: Jeff B.

description:
Tendernobs hidden gem. Amazing locally sourced, fresh ingredients, delicious pastries, OUTSTANDING coffee and great service. Frank the Pug Honey Latte is my favorite latte drink in the city-well worth the money. There is extremely limited seating so you have to come here with a relaxed mindset and expect that while your food is being made, you will most likely have to stand. In the year I've been going here I've never not gotten a place to sit down by the time my food is ready. To me, the coziness of the place is part of the charm. The menu is a little pricy but on par, if not a cheaper, than what the market is baring for the area. 

An additional reason I love going here is the owners are young, kind, cool, hardworking people and I think it's important to support small businesses in this community.
author: Brieanna H.

description:
A friend of mine and I were in town to hang out. We wanted to get some brunch because we love brunch. Even on a Tuesday. Yelp recommended this restaurant for brunch and was rated high. Its very close and confined, which I wouldn't mind, but if it were to get busy that would be annoying.

There are few items on the menu itself and some pastries. I wish that I saw there what I see in the photos of some of the reviews of the place. Most of the items were sold out (we got there at a very reasonable time (like 11am-ish), so seeing most of the items sold out was weird. You would think that in a city like SF, you wouldn;t be out of at least 3 dishes which only left like 2 maybe 3 others at 11am. 

The service was ''A-ok'' Nothing to really rave about. The guy, who looks like he might run the place, seemed kinda cocky and made a negative remark when I wanted a hot chocolate. As if me ordering it was bothersome. 

The pastry (sticky bun) tasted soapy, and my hot chocolate was ''meh''. I don;t think that I will come back again. Just wasn't impressed.
author: L S.

description: This place should be called "Farm to the Table" because there is only 1...and a small one at that. This has to be the least kid-friendly restaurant I have ever been to. DO NOT COME HERE WITH KIDS. The whole place is like 100sqft.
author: Paul K.

description:
Ok, it's good but misleading. If you read 'Farm' and think you are getting organic anything you will be disappointed. But I think we read into the name too much. That being said, most of the menu will still be good. Not everything is a winner, however, 2 out of 3 choices we tried were great. We ordered the fruit on toast with walnuts, Kale Salad, and Ham n Eggs on croissant sandwich. Here's the verdict on those:  
Fruit on toast: delicious, but wish there was a more generous serving of that yogurty spread to balance out all that bread, it's the thickest n fluffiest Texas toast ever. By the time you get through half the toast you're tired of all the bread 
And will probably jus lick the fruit off and be happy with that. 
Kale salad: the downer in the menu. Kale part of it was inedible due to it not being washed properly still having dirt stuck in it. It was gritty on the first bite. To properly wash kale you have to submerge it rather than just tu it under the faucet. They probably didn't realize it was still dirty.  The rest isn't much better, kinda boring in flavor compared to all the other beautiful ways they plate other items. 
It's also the only gluten free option :(
Ham and eggs. Nothing wrong with this, great taste and put together just right. A winner.
author: Mona L.

description: Came here early on a Saturday for a breakfast. I liked the vibe of the cafe, would be a cute place to meet a friend for a coffee, however space is limited. Options for food were a bit limited as well, but staff was friendly!
author: Ran W.

description: Went here while out with some friends on a weekend. This place was definitely a cute find. The vibe was very welcoming and positive. Also, the coffee was excellent (which is always a crucial part of any great breakfast spot).
author: Mia A.

description: We had high hopes for this place, but the lack of seating and long wait were disappointing. The food was good, but not worth the discomfort of eating on the sidewalk at a flimsy table. The decor outside was cool, but it was just too difficult to be enjoyable. And my food was cold. Latte was good though!
author: Christa F.

description: Wonderful, compact breakfast spot. Wonderful food. Staff is fabulous and the service was quick and perfect.
author: Douglas C.

description:
I was after a Californian style breakfast and farm:table was highly-rated on Yelp so I headed on over.

I was surprised that there was only about 10 seats and most of them were part of the street garden, so there would only be 6 seats available if it was raining. Luckily my two girlfriends and I scored the last 3 seats on a Friday morning, so it must be crazy busy on the weekend.

The food menu is very limited, I ordered the toast topped with mascarpone and sliced seasonal fruit, which was incredible! 

Service was very friendly, would be great if they had some more seating and a few more items on the menu.
author: Laura D.

description: Came to SF while my sister was visiting and we wanted to get cruffins from Mr. Holmes Bakery.  We just missed the cutoff for cruffins, so we decided to look somewhere else for breakfast.  This place was close by.  When we got here, the line was a little long and the place was really tiny.  The person who was taking the orders also delivered the orders.  By the time it was our turn to order, there were many orders ready to be served, so we waited about 5 minutes before she came back to take our order.  We ordered the everyday toast, bacon cheddar scone, and vegetable tart/quiche.  There was nowhere to sit, so we stood and ate our food.  The toast and scone were okay.  The tart/quiche was very bland and boring.  I would be okay with not returning, because nothing was spectacular.
author: Janet J.

description: The Daily Toast was delicious! I liked the unique, small intimate setting. The service was fast. And although the food was amazing, it was a little pricey.
author: Richard P.

description: Walked to this place on a Saturday morning and the line was way too long. Gave it a shot on a Monday to find out it was closed. Came back on Wednesday before going out to Sonoma, third times the charm. Also went back Thursday before heading to the airport because it was that good! The seating inside is very small, only about 8 people. But there are some tables outside. The staff is super friendly and service was excellent. The matcha chai tea is delicious, you get the spices from the chai and the creaminess of the matcha. I had the daily toast both times. The fruits and bread vary depending on what they have on hand but everything tastes amazing regardless! The savory tart looked amazing and smelled divine, my friend ordered that and the egg on croissant. Small menu but it works because everything is fresh and delicious.
author: Jessica P.

description:
We stumbled across this place while staying in SF. What a hidden gem! 
All the food was made fresh w delicious ingredients. Staff was incredibly nice and made everything w obvious love. 
Highly recommend!
author: Katy H.

description: Very quiet small quaint place with minimal outside seating. Walk in to order and they bring your food outside. Went for Sunday breakfast and the food was delicious. Limited menu and no hot items. Coffee was delicious. I would give 5 stars if there were more seating and some hot items to eat on the menu. But overall yummy and what you need to get going on your vacation.
author: Odalys B.

description:
After reading so many good reviews about this place, I thought I'd start my visit in SF with brunch here. BIG MISTAKE. Arrived here an hour before they were about to close.. Two words: ugh & annoyed. Totally killed my mood. This place is legit like a hole in the wall; too small and not enough seating. Service was so unorganized and uninformative. 

Don't get me wrong though, the daily toast was good. I also ordered the iced coffee, which was just whatever in my opinion.. I wouldn't pay 4$ for that again. My boyfriend ordered the egg sandwich which was supposed to be served on brioche buns. However, when I was ordering they didn't bother telling me that they ran out of brioche buns. Oh wait... That's because the people who ordered after me, got served before we did. My bf and I waited at least 30 minutes until they realized they messed up our order and served the wrong people.

Minus 2 stars for service.
author: Diana T.

description:
Egg on croissant,  and it's vegetarian version, were Perfection. We loved our macchiato and a steamer made from house-made almond milk.  The cinnamon roll was also great: not too sweet, crunchy in just the right way, with almonds.  

Small space, not great for groups or children.  More seating outside, though.
author: David R.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here around 9:45 am - 10 am and it was so crowded! But it was definitely worth the wait! I think some people were getting a little tired of the wait, but the food was seriously so good I would wait in the line again with no hesitation! Plus the employees were all super friendly when you got up to the counter and so it made you feel good about waiting.

The cafe isn't too big so don't expect to snag the one table they have in there. But I would rather sit outside anyways since there's more room. Plus you get to sit on their cool boat-like structure outside! 

It did take long to get our food, but when I took a bite, I forgot all about the waiting, which is why I gave this place 5 stars. The toast I had was so thick and huge! Bigger than I thought! It was smeared with a citrus mascarpone that paired perfectly with the fruits they had on top. I'm not sure if they change the flavor of the mascarpone with the toast, but it was delicious. My boyfriend got the egg and cheese croissant and it was the butteriest, and best croissant I've had. Highly recommend both! Especially the toast.
author: Hana B.

description: My second time here. I forgot that the menu options are limited, mostly sandwich and salad. Seating for six at one table inside, a few tables outside. Not on par with real four star brunch places. In fact, not a real brunch place, just quick breakfast provided you actually like any of the six menu options.
author: Thomas V.

description: Tiny little place with a large community table inside and a few pairs of regular tables outside. Total about 5 entrees so hopefully not too difficult to decide. Excellent food overall. My favorite was turmeric latte, which is just therapeutic (literally).
author: Ankur G.

description: Fun and different for a New Yorker food was great...sitting out side with that big cup of tea people watched was fun.
author: Leslie L.

description: It is overpriced BUT it has a very unique menu and atmosphere (so therefore justifiable). I love the location, it's very convenient and cute, and I'd come again. I feel like their kitchen would sell out if located in NYC. I had the fruit toast (super tasty and different) and matcha latte (amazing, reminded my friend and I of fall). Highly recommend.
author: Michelle G.

description: Daily Toast was so fresh - could taste the farm in it! Paired with the Milk & Honey, its perfect. The cardamom gives the drink the perfect kick. I also recommend the egg croissant, delicious buttery flakey goodness. Lastly, lemon poppyseed loaf is delicious and the coffee is good too. Worth the wait!
author: Kimia M.

description: Excellent tiny spot to get breakfast. Limited menu, but everything was wonderful. We had the mixed cereal/yogurt, oatmeal, boiled eggs, lemon poppyseed cake & black coffee. Solid all around.
author: Mary P.

description: Cute spot (super tiny), good coffee, ok food, expensive for what you get. Come by for a short break but would not recommend the food.
author: Kristine Y.

description:
Found farm:table on Yelp and decided to give it a try. My friend and I stopped by for brunch around 12:30 p.m. on a Saturday and it wasn't too crowded. All the seats were taken, but we got there as people were finishing up. We ordered the egg croissant and the toast of the day (I think that's what it was called -- had mascarpone and fresh fruit). I had the House Juice, which was pretty good but the cup was rather small for $3. My friend got a latte and she seemed to enjoy it. The egg croissant ($7.50) was good, but very small. The toast ($7.50) was very yummy, and it was pretty big. While we enjoyed the meal, this place was definitely more for the "look" and "hipstery" feel rather than food (I hope that makes sense). While it was a cute little cafe/restaurant, the food was overpriced (and serve in those paper dishes that are for fries...) and the restaurant was very small.

Glad to have tried farm:table, but won't be coming back.
author: Doris K.

description:
This place is TINY & absolutely bustling!
We popped in for brekky & we're lucky to score a table outside - there's one big table inside (seating maybe 6) & a few outside so we did well to get one!

The menu is also very small but solid with what's on offer. We tried the fried egg croissant and croque monsieur which were both really tasty but probably not great for the arteries!

The coffee was unfortunately horrendous - I didn't end up drinking it at all.

Overall I could take or leave this place!
author: Victoria C.

description: Be aware that this place literally has one table. It's tiny but delicious. My gf and I shared a savory tart and the daily toast. Both were great. The lavender latte was delicious and not too flowery. Would definitely come back!
author: Melissa H.

description:
line:sidewalk
brunch:snack
pigeon:buddy
hipster:tourist
skyfall:skyfall
farm:table
author: Dan B.

description: My friends and I made three attempts to come here. The first two were fails because Sunday morning gets super crowded and we were in a rush so we couldn't stay to wait and on Mondays they aren't open. On our third attempt the following Tuesday.. SUCCESS! The restaurant is very small and seats a total of eight inside and can seat a few people out side on their little platform. On Tuesday I ordered the daily toast and the macchiato. I am extremely impressed on how simple yet delicious their food is. The fruits on the toast were extremely fresh and crisp and you can tell that the fruit are sliced as orders come in. On Thursday we returned ! I have the savory tart which was another amazing experience. It was served with a side salad which again was extremely fresh! These folks really know what they're doing
author: My-Oanh N.

description: Best breakfast place ever. The daily toast with farm fresh fruits was delicious. My daughter loved the steel cut oatmeal - it was the best ever with a combination of fruits. The space is tight but the fresh local produce makes it worthwhile.
author: Savinay D.

description: Small, cute place that is good for a quick bite (portions are pretty small). I highly recommend the daily toast. So pretty and yummy!! I also tried the egg sandwich and savory tart, but they were just okay. I wouldn't get them again. The egg sandwich wasn't served on a croissant that day though, and I loveee croissants, so maybe I'll have to give it another try.
author: Annie S.

description: Came here last weekend and the food was incredible!! I ordered the daily toast, which includes a thick slice of toast, a sweet cream spread, and a selection of seasonal fruits. The toast itself was nicely toasted, and the cream spread on the top was incredible. It was sweet but not overly sweet. I would highly recommend it! However, seating is a little difficult as they can probably only fit 15 people seated on the tables outside and the big table inside.
author: Chris C.

description:
Not much to choose from as far as food selections but by keeping it simple you're guaranteed a few tasty options. 
Great coffees and juice to pair up your breakfast sandwich or whatever 

Cosy community table and sidewalk seating.
Get creative and eat where you are lucky to find a spot 

I'll be back
author: Fritz P.

description: Great atmosphere, good breakfast and coffee, awesome eggs, wonderful hash browns. Excellent service.
author: Arya S.

description:
Great tiny place... I had the Daily Toast and its delicious! 
Small table inside and few more outside.
Unique place none in SD.
But i don't know  why they take too long to clean up after a customer leaves !
author: Dcruz L.

description:
This place is a delight! I arrived at 9am Sunday morning and the seating was completely full, but that wasn't a problem because there's a nice standing area outside that lets you still feel like you're a part of the restaurant atmosphere. The staff were really friendly patient (so many drinks to decide from) 

I ended up ordering a mocha and their ever so famous Daily Toast and both were Delicious!! The mocha was warm, chocolately, slightly frothy on top, and most importantly only marginally sweet!! The most perfect mocha doesn't need any added sugar and this was exactly that. I LOVED my mocha, and if you're not a huge supporter of sweet coffee drinks, then I would definitely recommend trying the mocha.

The Daily Toast: ok so I came in here thinking, "I don't get the deal with the toast, it's just bread with beautifully sliced fruit"...But omg, so what makes the toast delicious is their delicately sweetened mascarpone cheese that tops the crusty sweet and slightly salty rustic bread. It was Delicious!!

So you might wonder, why 4 starts and not 5? And this is solely for price. The mocha was $5 and toast was $8 something without tip, so thought it was a bit pricey for what you get. 

Aside from that, would definitely recommend stopping by if yore looking for a cute breakfast bite!
author: Katie 2.

description:
Delicious bite to eat here this morning. It is absolutely tiny (one table and then some stools I believe?), and you order at the counter. I tried the mascarpone toast with fresh fruit, a cinnamon sugar twist, and egg croissant. 

I'll be back!
author: K. D.

description: Great service, and excellent food. Authentic breakfast with a personal touch. Highly reccomend it!
author: Jonathan G.

description: This place was a very cute local cafe & brunch spot. We were very glad to come across it in our search - the food was fresh and absolutely delicious. We had the stuffed croissant and ham croissant that melted in our mouths... I would recommend coming here for brunch, but be warned - the space is small!
author: Patrick C.

description:
Eight dollars for some daily toast.  

They literally have one shared table.

Some outdoor tables (maybe 3).

Lots of coffee choices.  

Super friendly service.

Yummy brioche toast with mascarpone, strawberries, raspberries, apricot topped with crushed pistachios.

Very tasty, light & refreshing!
author: Crystal M.

description: I knew San Fran had great coffee, and we were really lucky to find it here on our first morning! It was so delicious, along with the yogurt/cereal/berry breakfast, that we came back the following morning. Just plan accordingly because the line is long and the seating is fairly limited, but it was totally worth it.
author: Anna S.

description: Cute place with their own garden outside. Seating is extremely limited both inside and outside. My favorite was the daily toast, I loved the fresh fruit and pistachio combo. Everything tastes fresh, but their portion sizes are quite small.
author: Wendy L.

description:
Waited way too long (almost 45 minutes) for what ended up being a mediocre egg sandwich.

EDIT: the owner reached out just a few hours after I wrote the review and asked what she could do to better my experience - I am impressed that management is so quick to address unhappy customers. Glad to see they care about the experience.
author: Avneet S.

description: So happy I came here !!! I ordered the daily toast & must have it again before I leave Saturday , The only reason I cannot give this place 5 stars is I feel they need to offer side of bacon or something with it :) and also needs more seating because this place fills up fast. The presentation was truly beautiful and delicious I had it with a milk and honey it's served warm sprinkled with a little love & cardamon simply delicious. My husband ordered a coffee and daily toast he was pleased with his meal too. The place is adorable and charming we were one of the first people there so we got a seat outside. And man did the people start packing in after  so our timing was perfect . Go and check it out if you can.
author: Leah F.

description:
This review is just for the Italian breakfast I had: a cappuccino and the chocolate croissant. Amazing. Very good. I would get it again. I also enjoyed my friend's fruit-cheese-toast thing.

The restaurant has a very hipster vibe that you'd except from a popular SF place. Lot of people crammed into the tiny indoor seating area and a couple more standing outside near the mini park areas recently put up. 

Overall it's a little pricey for the quantity, but worth it if you're going for a quick bite.
author: Nishad J.

description:
I highly recommend ordering the daily toast! 
(A bit pricey, ~$8) The toast tastes so good with all the different fruits laying on top of the mascarpone. I would definitely come back.
author: Sandy C.

description: Tiny little local place with awesome coffee and winderful breakfast options. Very small menu but they nail every option and all in menu very delicious. They also have gluten free bread for all the bfast items.
author: Kimberly W.

description: terrific food, including excellent gluten-free options at this tiny spot. service is friendly. one inside table seats 8, tightly and there are a few small tables outside. i was bummed that the almond milk wasn't ready at 8a. and unfortunately tourists (like me!) have discovered it and there is a long line that makes the experience feel rushed. come, but in off-hours.
author: Lucinda D.

description:
Stuff is fresh but for a $11 breakfast (sandwich + drip coffee) it's expected.

Can't rate them higher because of the drip coffee. Very over-extracted and got all the undesired sour/bitter/ashy taste. They probably use high-quality beans but it's a waste when you are sloppy at the brewing process.

The sandwich is good, and the service is friendly. Very good personality.
author: Joseph L.

description: Great super fresh choices. Small selection of food items but super fresh, homemade, & delicious. Unique coffee/latte choices. Love the lavender & Nutella latte optionsHomemade cereal/granola looked delish but didn't get to try. Loved the toast w/marscopne fruit toast & breakfast croissant.  Staff was extra friendly & customer service was top notch
author: Kathie Z.

description: Cute, cozy cafe in the tenderloin district of SF. Farm fresh foods. I got the toast with mascarpone and seasonal fruits. It's literally a masterpiece too good to eat (almost like having dessert for breakfast!). Coffee is strong and good. I just wish they had more of a selection on their menu (only 3-4 food items) and more indoor seating.
author: Natalie P.

description: One of my favorite breakfast spots in the TL because of the parklet outside, the gracious owner, and solid food. Order from the written menu on the chalkboard, it's constantly changing. I have to say the daily toast is quite something, and the quiches never fail to please. Also, the croissant sandwich is delightful. This is one of my favorite places to bring a friend or date. Just keep an eye on the opening hours of this place - they close pretty early sometimes (and then I have to trudge up the hill to another coffee place at 2pm).
author: Angie C.

description: Love the special toast with the fruits on top as well as the house cereal. Really want to know what kind of cereal it is and where to get it. The cold pressed juices are also decent.
author: Aakash P.

description: Really cool small cafe with seating curbside at the public parklet.  Delicious Daily Toast!
author: Tony M.

description:
Sanitation Issues!
 Have you guys ever pay attention on how they made food? At least something terrible happened to me this afternoon. A guy just finished swiping his cellphone, and use that bare hand touched my food, put my food back into the little oven. Couple minutes later, another guy came back with a tray has red oil paint (assumed he was painting outside); he put down the tray, use his bare hands finished making my food. No hand wash, no food gloves. I guess I will report this inappropriate behavior.
author: Anne M.

description:
I had the best breakfast in San Francisco, sitting at a small table on the side walk and eating food from farm:table. If you asked me what my favorite part of San Francisco was, I would answer with eating. If you asked me eating what meal? I'd answer with breakfasts. If you followed up with which breakfast meal was your favorite? I'd answer with my meal at farm:table.

Now, I couldn't give it a full five stars because part of me was sad about their prices:portion ratio. And a little annoying voice in my head told me I could make these breakfast meals at home at a fraction of the cost. But I was in San Francisco, and really small-annoying-voice-in-my-brain, where would you have time to gather all these ingredients and make a daily toast for yourself? Exactly. So suck it up and give them four stars because no matter how much emptier they made your wallet, you still enjoyed a darn good meal.

Husband and I ordered an egg croissant, the daily toast, and a cup of their coffee. Loved all three things we ordered. I started eating the daily toast and really enjoyed all the different kinds of fresh fruits they piled on it. Then I looked across the table and saw my husband munching on the egg croissant and I had a strong sense of food envy. We switch plates half way through and I finished of that egg croissant because I hadn't realized that a hard boiled egg on a croissant was the best tasting breakfast ever. They I reached across the table and snagged the last bite of the daily toast out from right under my husband's fork. He retaliated by downing the rest of the coffee. Did I mention that this San Fransisco trip is part of our wedding anniversary celebration? Well it is and we love food, I mean, each other.

Good stop and worth it to have breakfast here. You know, if you have about $30 to spend for breakfast.
author: Katrina H.

description:
Tiny spruced up hole in the wall. This is the equivalent of a hole in the wall with a major makeover that will make you think it's so fancy! But they only really offer one thing. The toast! I was wondering why people were so into this toast. Then I got the toast and it was really beautiful. Lightly covered in sweet cream cheese. Neatly sliced fruits align it in a colorful kaleidoscopic pattern.

I had a really bitter espresso with it. Ever since my trip to Italy no American version of espresso can compare. But the toast is pretty good. I went on a weekday morning and it wasn't quite so busy yet.
author: Mary P.

description:
I was staying at a Union Square hotel with really terrible coffee. This was the closest independent (non-Starbucks) coffee option I could find. Really awesome coffee and worth the walk. The food looked great and wished I had time to sit and enjoy breakfast. 

I'll be back.
author: Lesley A.

description:
With the small amount of options, I'd be hard-pressed to go 4 stars; but this is a good place for breakfast, especially if you are taking out. 
Small and quaint breakfast place. It's nestled in right across from the Marriott. They were a typical small shop with limited choices. I had the Tuna Melt which was VERY good. The service was prompt and friendly. The coffee was average at best.
author: Kyle D.

description:
After wanting to try farm:table forever, I finally got to eat here! I came with a friend on a weekday morning and was surprised to see it crowded (side note: what jobs do these people have that allow them to eat here on a weekday?!). Maybe because the place is small so it  can get crowded easily. We waited in line for a while, which only built up the anticipation. I ordered the lavender latte (I've recently been obsessed with lavender anything) and the daily toast with fruit. The lavender latte was really good - not too sweet or lavender-y. The toast with fruit was also very good and I like that they use seasonal fruit so its fresh. For extra crunch, they add pistachios on top, which I love. While the toast was delicious, it wasn't very filling. I was hungry a couple of hours later, which usually doesn't happen after a brunch. Also, the prices aren't the cheapest so I kind of wish there was more to the toast. Maybe next time I'll get the toast with egg, which should be more filling. 

There isn't a lot of sitting room so be prepared to either a) glare at people who are done to give up their table or b) eat standing up. Luckily, my friend and I found a table as the other party was leaving (no glares needed). 

I recommend coming here and checking it out at least once even if its for their tea/coffee selection.
author: Krishna S.

description: I searched vegan on Yelp and idk why this place came up because I went and they had all of one option for me, the cereal. I'm not a cereal person but I needed something in my stomach before Bay to Breakers so I ordered it. It was pretty and tasted fine. Again, cereal is not my thing but if it's yours, you'd love it. Space is super tight. There is only one community table inside and some random seating outside. Staff is not so friendly, perhaps because they're in such a small space and there are way more customers than they can handle.
author: This Vegan Life Z.

description: Stayed at Marriott across street and wanted some good coffee. This place is tiny but the coffee was excellant! Got a latte and a cold brew with espresso. Only about 8 people can sit inside, 3-5 outside and there is usually a line. Every morning I looked outside there was a line. Enjoyed the coffee. I doubt I would eat there. Apparently there is a no glove policy when handling food because no had them on. Saw one guy palm down on what looked like a quiche slicing it..... nope.
author: Trea S.

description:
This is probably a family owned small brunch joint in the middle of SF so I will not knock on it too much. Very small and cozy place that fits about 6-8 people in seating if people snuggled together, otherwise fits about 5 in terms of seating with a rear kitchen where you can see most of your food items made. 

Very simple menu for about $8 per item. My girlfriend and I ordered the daily toast and the egg on croissant. They weren't too bad but also not a great value for $8. The one thing I'd say is, the presentation of the meal item is pretty. Other than that, if you are looking to get filled, this isn't really the place to go. It's more of a quick snack, coffee shop type brunch place. 

Food was prepped and made fairly quick. 

Tips:
1) Get there early to get seating!
2) Enjoy!
author: Kevin W.

description:
Quick: Great food, worth the wait, make sure to check your order if you order your food to go.

TL;DR: The Hubbs and I are on a road trip through San Francisco, and we chose this place to get breakfast on our journey through.  

This place was super cute, and the food was delicious!  I had the savory tart w/ side salad.  The salad was dressed perfectly, and the tart was good, fluffy & light.  The crust could have been flakier, and the filling could have been slightly more seasoned, but overall it was very pleasing.

Hubbs had the breakfast croissant, ordered it with no ham, sub avocado.  Asked if there was any other meat on it, the gentleman taking the order said no.
We get our order to go, and book out to continue our journey.  On the road, we get to our breakfast, and discover ham on the sandwich, with no avocado.  As vegetarians, it's unfortunate that after specifying no meat on the sandwich, and waiting so long in the line, then after waiting for our food, and no time to go back to get the order corrected, that we had to find an alternate solution.  

The reason for the 3 stars is exactly that.  For the quality of ingredients used, and the care that they seem to put into their food, they should be equally caring about getting an order correct.  Please go here, but if you have dietary restrictions, make sure to check your order before leaving the establishment.
author: Natalie W.

description: Toast is one of my all time favorite things, so I personally hyped up the daily toast at farm:table for awhile before finally trying it. Although it's beautifully presented with a wide assortment of fresh seasonal fruit, it was underwhelming. The brioche isn't heated up at all, so you just get soft bread with soft mascarpone and soft fruit. I actually liked the egg croissant sandwich much better, with buttery flaky layers sandwiching hard boiled eggs, arugula and ham. I wanted to love farm:table, but probably won't be back for that toast.
author: Ashley T.

description: Spent $60 for three croissants with over-cooked (green yolk) eggs, fruit toast, and three just-okay coffees. This place isn't great nor is it awful but the price to value isn't there. Hipster prices without the quality.
author: M T.

description:
I could actually taste how fresh the ingredients are.
Loved every single menu they had. I think the price is pretty expensive but it's reasonable for what you get. The seasonal toast was my favorite!
author: Ibi Y.

description: Awesome little nook spot for a super fresh breakfast/lunch.. Not a huge menu, but often times less is more. Had the daily toast and savory tart. Both were amazing. Will definitely be back!
author: Gas Light Apparel 1.

description:
Food was really good but staff was a bit sassy at first. 

Honestly, the food is really great. Everything was seasoned quite well. I had the biscuit with candied bacon along side with peppers, an aoli and a few greens.

The staff however, weren't so friendly and when I are outside, they weren't that attentive. Not once did anyone check up on me to see how I was doing after they delivered my meal. A woman though, did check up on the table that was next to me but never me. There are only 3 people working the place. 

Metered parking is right in front of the place but make sure you have quarters because farm table won't help you with the quarter/meter situation.
author: Jermel-Lynn Q.

description:
Don't let the name scare you away! I thought this was just a typo or a green grocer and am glad now that I took the time to explore more. This was only because  I was staying at USA Hostels, which is almost directly across frame farm:table. 

The restaurant is seating-challenged, but not seating-impossible.  As I walked up to farm:table a 20-something lanky male bounded by me to grab the just-open table outside that I was eyeing.  He was a a**hole,  and it took me a minute to readjust my expectations, remember I am in CA and telling him off will wreck only my day.  Instead, I took a seat inside at the large table and was surrounded by friendly, cheerful pleasant people.  We all kept to ourselves, but friendly grins and minor adjustments to allow folks to squeeze in. 

Based on the reviews here I ordered the daily toast and a pot of tea.  I also asked for an egg.  The staff was friendly, professional and efficient!  The meal  was delicious and beautifully presented!  The hard-boiled egg had sprouts surround it. My fruit was apples and I felt ripped off at first (see previous paragraph to see I was till calming down).  I was NOT.

The combination of textures (crunchy apples, cheese, ground nuts) was a pleasure to taste and eat.  The toast is large and the meal was more than filling. The top was ground pistachios, lending color and a nice nutty and salty contrast.  

I recommend farm:table, but wouldn't go in a group.
author: Maureen D.

description: Loved this place !!! Finally somewhere that lives up to the hype. We had an almond milk latte as well as the milk and honey and both were superb! Thick, full of flavor and I didn't want either one to reach the end. Also had their toast and croissant sandwich and was very pleased with both
author: Frankie G.

description:
First: This place is SUPER SMALL. the place is literally 1 table inside a 10 x 12 foot room. no joke. so, keep that in mind if you go with people.

Second: I think there's definitely rating inflation from fans of "farm to table" type places. The food was fine (Latte wasn't good though), but you can't really mess up the simple dishes they make. Like seriously, it's a really simple menu. 

Bottom-line: Ultimately, it is super pricey, no guarantee you even have a place to sit, and everyone is crammed in like sardines. Sorry, that's a no go.
author: Grapes T.

description: Wow!!! I can't even explain in words how good this place is. My GF and I were in San Francisco last year at this time and decided to try the Farm Table based of reviews and there was no looking back. We came 3 of our 5 days last year, (we went on our 3rd day last year) ;) . So with that said it was one of the first places we wanted to come back to on our return. We were so excited to sit outside and drink their supper good coffee and indulge in their Daily Toast. Never have we tasted anything like it. I was hesitant to leave a review last year because I didn't want this place to become so "crowded and touristy" but Coming back this year and dealing with the friendly staff and fast service it would be unfair not to rave about this place. It's a MUST TRY when in San Francisco!
author: E G.

description:
Went to Farm:Table on a Friday morning & was so impressed. Their food is so fresh and brought straight from the Farm (Thus, their name). 

Seating is really limited. They have a little communal seating area inside, and some cool looking benches outside to chill on. 

What we ordered: 

Daily Toast (Mascarpone Cheese + Fresh Fruit) ($7.50) was very delicious. Cripsy bread, fresh fruit.. but I don't know if it's worth $7.50.. 

House Juice: Super tiny for what it costs (around 3? dollars)

Milk & Honey: Thought this was worth the price! Yummy creamy drink

Everything looks amazing, but the only thing is that it's overpriced. But I guess thats what you have to pay to get super fresh food.
author: Jane K.

description: honestly I thought the food was going to be terrible based on the limited menu choices BUT I was wrong.  I recommend getting the croissant avocado thing, the cereal and the toast thing for 2 people.  I think just one item is not enough for a single person.  All surprisingly delicious and would happily go back.
author: Clayton S.

description: So impressed by this small and interesting place.  I walked in expecting a full blown restaurant, and was surprised to see a few tables and a few chairs.  However, the food was delicious!
author: Ali C.

description: This was the best breakfast I had while I was in San Francisco. I ordered the croissant sandwich but also had to get the daily toast because it looked heavenly. It took awhile to get my food, longer than I would have liked for breakfast, but it really was worth the wait. I took mine to go because the place is tiny and seating in minimal but the staff was super nice, the food was amazing, and the prices weren't completely outrageous. If you are in the area it is totally worth stopping by!
author: Joie S.

description:
My friend and I were looking for a brunch place to stop by that was decently priced in the downtown area, and fortunately happened to stumble upon this place. After seeing the other pictures and the price for what it is, we were sold and took a nice walk to this place.

I had the Egg on Croissant which was absolutely amazing. The portion is a little small, but the ratio of each ingredient put into it was a perfect blend. My friend had the quiche which was also delicious, and the slice was pretty large as well if you're skeptical about how satisfied your stomach will be. Something I do wish I had tried was the daily toasts -- so maybe next time! We both got the Seasonal House Juice which at the time was a blend of Apples, Oranges, and Grapefruit I believe (I could be wrong... I vaguely remember), but it was super refreshing! 

Something about this place also is that it's a little bit small -- just something to look out for if you were looking for more of your standard sit-down, dine-in place; there might not be enough seating for you depending on when you go. They have one large square table inside and some outdoor seating.
author: Brian T.

description: Nice atmosphere of busyness. The house cereal is (I believe) Special-k with not fully ripe fruit and vanilla yogurt. I don't recommend. Drip coffee was very good.
author: John A.

description: Tried here on saturday. We tried the egg croissant and tuna salad or toast (im not sure). The server/cashier was pretty chill. The food tastes really fresh and it is great for brakfast/brunch. I see some people complain about the price of it, but it is bay area... what do you expect? Anyways, besides the small area of the store (which didnt affect us that much) everything was enjoyable. Will be back if I happened to go back to san francisco
author: SuJun K.

description:
I came her yesterday and I really enjoyed the food and drinks. I ordered the daily toast and a milk and honey. My friend ordered the daily toast and a matcha latte. She really enjoyed them too. I think the service was mediocre. Not extremely good or bad. But the wait for the food is absolutely insane. We waited 1 hour for our daily toast to come and when the order came only one of the daily toasts came. And I finished it all before my friend even got her daily toast. The drinks came out extremely fast but I was hoping to enjoy the drink with the toast but nope. I finished  the drink before the food even came. I would not come back if I was in a rush or want to wait that long and there was no one before us either. The toast isn't even hard to make. It's a slice of toast with cream cheese and some fruits on the top. That is definitely not worth an one hour wait. Overall I would just come back for the drinks.
--------------------------------------------------
I came here again with my friend and this time it was on point. The servers were friendly and the food did not take forever however i liked the fruits on the daily toast last time more. They had raspberries, blackberries, peaches, strawberries but this time they had apples, blackberries not as exciting or pretty. I got a milk and honey and so did my friend and we really enjoyed it. The surrounding plants look nice. We were able to take artsy pictures for Instagram. And the food is Instagram worthy too! I would recommend this place!
author: Carissa C.

description: Quick service, food was good. However, I don't know if I just got the wrong impression of a particular worker there but he had a bit of an attitude. Wasn't very friendly, didn't help with suggestions, pretty much wanted us to order and head out. Maybe it's because the place is very small, but I would have liked to not feel rushed to pick something out since I had never been there before.
author: Alyssa M.

description:
This place is so perfect for what it is. I have been here twice in 1 month. During the weekends, this place gets packed!

Gotta get the daily toast, it does change daily based on seasonal fruits. It's worth the calories.

Green Tea Latte, perfect for all you non-coffee drinkers.

Mixed fruit juice- pass on this one.
author: Carrie Y.

description:
This is a quaint little hole in the wall around the Tenderloin area (I could be wrong, I'm fairly inexperienced with the different sub sections of San Francisco). Emphasis on "little" and "quaint". They have one table inside that takes up the entire place, which I assume is family style if there are multiple parties of two rather than one solid group of 6. There was a small bar outside looking into the restaurant's open window with about 2 or three stools, and then a peculiar planter box set up across from the front door that probably wasn't meant for seating but people sit on it anyways because there is essentially nowhere to sit. 
We arrived late morning, probably about 10 am, with a line out the door -- to be expected. The place only holds about four people in line on the inside. The menu had a good variety -- breakfast sandwiches, classic pastries, classic and unique coffee/tea/lemonade drinks, and the like. 
We had the infamous breakfast toast. I was hesitant because I prefer savory in the morning, but it was raved about so much I had to try it, and it did not disappoint. They load seasonal fruit onto a thick, soft white bread with a mascarpone cream in the middle. While this won't fill you up for the entire day (at least not for me), it's definitely worth trying. The prices are decent per item but if you were to order multiple things for yourself, that's where it gets more expensive. 
The service was good; it seemed like they had one guy bussing, taking orders, and serving orders all at once with everyone else cooking or working as baristas behind the counter. I want to say they were most likely understaffed but it would be hard to staff such a small place properly. There's no room. 
I think if you're into the farm to table type fare and love seeing tiny cute coffee shops with good, fair portioned food -- check this place out. I don't think I will run right back the next time I'm in the city, but they had a line out the door for a good reason.
author: Marissa B.

description:
Very small coffee and tea spot. It seems like a mom and pop shop though! Servers were nice. We ordered our stuff "for here". They delivered to us. Presentation was definitely on point. Limited seating - 2 tables outside and one inside where you'll share with either friends you make the day of or strangers. ;) I didn't even know there's a restroom behind the espresso bar! 

- Iced Coffee - a blend of cold-brewed coffee, cream, and sugar ($4.00). Kind of tasted as strong as Vietnamese coffee, but without the condensed milky feel.
- Mocha - Dark and dry, 60% TCHO chocolate ($5.00). My absolute favorite. Didn't think I cared for it, but on this cold windy day it sure gave me a little bit of a kick and warmed me up.
- Pickled egg sandwich with bacon jam, créme fraiche, and pea shoots ($7.00). The egg was purple, but tasted sweet and the bread was soft and crunchy at the same time. 
- Pulled pork sandwich with pickled beets, carrots, and herbs ($9.00). The pulled pork was really juicy and full- flavored with the beets.

Total about $27 with tax included. I would come back again to try their toast since they were out this time around. :( ... Until next time!
author: Tina N.

description: Great place for a weekend brunch. The seating is limited so make sure you come in early. The food is great , we ordered a daily toast and egg croissant and it was amazing.
author: Aditi S.

description: We went there bc of ratings. No comfortable seating area. The toast specialty is sweet like you are having desert for breakfast.
author: Aysem O.

description: The place is really small but charming. Service was nice but a little slow which makes sincr there were quite a few people around. I got a matcha Chai latte and the daily toast. Both were amazing. Filling but not too sweet.
author: AMBER A.

description: A great place for quick bite. I recently tried the Eggs on Croissant, I found it to be not super filling but definitely rich in taste. I would say it makes a great snack and awesome with a morning coffee pairing. Not many tables available for seating, so might be a good idea to grab food to go, and enjoy it at home or Union Square (only a few blocks away). Looking forward to going back and trying other items on the menu.
author: Anurag S.

description: Farm:table is adorable and cozy. We had the house cereal (stir up the jam in the yogurt with the crunchy cereal and fruit- so yummy) and the broccoli bacon tart (pretty much a quiche). Top it off with some savory beverages like the milk n' honey and an Americano and we were a happy couple.
author: Karen A.

description:
I come here regularly and I've noticed that the efficiency of the service depends on who's working behind the counter. The service is getting more consistent with each visit. 

DO NOT APPRECIATE LEAVING FARM:TABLE SMELLING OF BACON GREASE: I'M NOT SURE WHY YOU GUYS STARTING SERVING BACON, BUT THE PLACE IS TOO SMALL FOR THAT! MY RECENTLY DRY CLEANED CLOTHES HAVE TO GO BACK TO THE DRY CLEANER BECAUSE THE BACON GREASE ODOR IS ALL OVER EVERYTHING I WAS WEARING AFTER SITTING INSIDE TO EAT FOR 15 MINUTES. *I'm a vegetarian--so there is some bias included in my update. Still, NOT COOL!!!

The food is light and delicious, but nearly every time my boyfriend and I come here they forget our drinks (typically if we sit outside), it is pretty inconvenient to wait, just to realize that they forgot, this has happened way too many times and I hope it's something that they work towards correcting. 

We love coming here, it's so close to home..
author: Maya B.

description:
It's impossible for me to talk about all the good things on the menu because I could not get away from the croissant with egg. I ate it all three times I had the chance  though I added avocado to it once. It was magical it was so good. Literally every crumb was worth eating. Amazing. 
Great coffee, too.
author: Robert G.

description: Super small, super GOOD!! Whenever I return to San Francisco I will be stopping here!
author: Dayana V.

description: A tiny restaurant serves impressive foods. The decorations were very cute which made me feel like I am in a rustic town. A must try was their Daily Toast. The fluffy and warm toast served with fresh fruits and mascarpone. What a healthy way to start your day! I also ordered the Milk n Honey. The flavour of the milk surprised me. It is the best milk drink I've ever tried. The sprinkled lavender levelled up this beverage. I feel hungry when I am writing this review, I can't wait to taste this wonderful breakfast spot again!
author: Jui Han Y.

description:
Wow. What a cute little find. My friend suggested it so figured why not check it out. First of all all the guys that work are handsome and sweethearts - and that made the fresh food even more delicious. Eye candy always makes brunch better  loved the out door sitting area - great ambience and loved the dessertscape planters 

Definitely will come back next time I'm in town. The yogurt bowl always amazing :)
author: Raja B.

description:
This place was ok. 
My friend who lives a block away wanted us to come here because because it was our last brunch together in sf. 
At first I was shocked at how limited the menu was- maybe about 4-5 options, but she kept ranting about how fresh the ingredients are.

I ordered the steel cut oats- without the pulled pork because I'm vegetarian. It was ok. It prob tastes better with the meat. I wasn't too thrilled about the food, but the service was very friendly.

The almond mocha and honey milk are delicious! I would come back just for these two drinks.
author: Court S.

description: Great little spot in SF to grab a quick and delicious breakfast.  Super fresh and wonderful
author: Steve R.

description:
Need a respite where I can kinda kick it for a bit before heading out to the next thing. Farm table is that place.

Why I come to the table +'s:
+ It's cozy. Sidle up to someone in the wood bench against the wall or share the sole table with perhaps four others
+ It's the coffee roasted from Oakland that keeps the crowds coming. Sheesh is it all happening in Oakland?!
+ Snag a pastry here but they run out fast
+ Friendly peeps
+ Nice parklet in the front

Why I take it to go -'s:
- Um it's hard to find a seat
- Closes early so gotta go somewhere else
- The limited menu options (four choices) are priced at $7.50 seems hefty for even SF

Coming back because I just want to sit in someone else's place and not see everyone is on their phone or laptop
author: Yiven C.

description: Why so highly reviewed? I'm not sure why.  Pretty run of the mill breakfast place.  Food is expensive for the portion.  I mean it's not expensive in general but when I pay 7 bucks for a croissant sammich I want more food.  The toast was ok as well.  Yes it is fresh and it looks nice but man I could make this at home!  Not a lot of seating either, just one small community table inside and two little outdoor tables and some stools outside.  Definitely not what I expected from a highly rated brunch/breakfast place.  I guess people like it cause its a quick grab and go?  I dunno.  Average for me but not bad.
author: Jeremy C.

description: Limited menu but all delicious options! I had the homemade cereal with fresh almond milk-amazing!! My fellow diner enjoyed the savory tart and was equally pleased. The entire place is lively! Some items were sold out, tip-go early! We arrived around 11am. Outdoor seating is nice.
author: Lauren K.

description: What a disappointment! I was so excited for this place since I drooled over the instagram pic for their daily toast. This place is really really small. There is only one big table inside and few small tables outside. I ordered their famous daily toast and egg croissant. It was 2pm and they were all out of croissant and bread for daily toast so they substituted it. When the toasts came out, it looked nothing like the picture. The fruits lacked colors and variety...I can just make these at home (maybe I wasn't lucky :( ) Since my first experience with this place was bad, I don't think I will visit here again!
author: Jessica S.

description: Disappointed. Insisted to the hubs we go here based on the good ratings, wish we had skipped.  Very limited menu (consisting of 4 breakfast items), long wait, limited seating, & once we received our food it was bland.  Skip this one.
author: Jillian C.

description: I could say this is one if the best brunch/cafe I've been to. Tiny space but ain't a problem. The croissaint with egg is SOOOOO DAMN GOOD. It's simple but idk why it's that good. Caramel macciato and honey milk are spot on. Can't ask for anythung better!
author: Nuntanat R.

description: Can't go wrong with the daily toast. Limited seating but it's the perfect little place to go for coffee and a quick bite. Highly recommended.
author: lisa n.

description:
Sunday brunch: The line just to order food was ridiculously slow. 
The lady taking our order was also the server. There was also just 1 cook. 

Toast-yummy & different. The spread was delicious and fruit was very fresh. 

Juice made in house: nothing special. 

Probably wouldn't come back. It's just all hype & fluff, not much else.
author: Tina H.

description: Farm:table offers healthy, fresh food. The place is small, menu is small. We had the tuna melt for breakfast. Strange, but delicious. After the meal we did not feel bloated. I had the matcha tea latte as well. I have a sweet tooth so I did wish it were a bit sweeter, but overall, we were satisfied with our meal.
author: Minh N.

description: Tiny little place in a busy district, not a lot on the menu but what they do have is worth the wait AND the crowded area ;)
author: Vanessa M.

description:
It's a tiny spot - either sit at the communal table indoors or 2 tiny tables outdoors or at the little parklet right outside. We got their daily toast ($7.75) and milk & honey ($3). 

The daily toast came on 2 slices of focaccia with vanilla mascarpone and raspberries, strawberries, grapes and apricots, and was topped with pistachios. Definitely tasty and very pretty to look at, but I'm not sure it's worth the price.

I got the milk & honey with their housemade almond milk, and it was very good! Highly recommend, also good value for the price. The almond milk is nice and creamy, nothing like those watered down versions you get in grocery stores. It was very subtly sweet, which was perfect.

Service was hit or miss though. Some were friendly, but the girl who served our toast simply plonked it on the table without a word and left. Nice place to chill and chat, but one star off for the prices and service.
author: Casatrina L.

description:
How can I write a review that they truly deserve? This place is truly amazing! 

It's a small gem on Post in the Tenderloin that brings you to a small corner shop in Paris. Although there is only one communal wooden table inside this place, you will appreciate the decor inside. 

I ordered the daily toast (thicker toast, I think with whipped almond butter) topped with all kinds of beautiful fresh fruit (blackberry, apple slices, fig, pear, strawberries, blueberries and grapes). 

The ham croissant with boiled eggs were also sooo good and delicious. The actual croissant was pretty ordinary but I think the whole dish itself and the flavors came together to make a phenomenal dish. 

You must try to order their daily juice. I really didn't expect much when I ordered, but I ordered anyway to give it a try. When I took a sip, WOW! It was soooo fresh and delicious. Delicately balanced with multiples of flavors that was not too sweet. 

Staff were friendly and everything was awesome!
author: Sarah K.

description:
This is one of my favorite places to grab breakfast. I love how fresh everything is. The daily toast is not only beautiful, but so delicious. I love that they will switch up the flavors of the mascarpone cheese. I've had cinammon, I've had curry. They are all good. The fresh is always so fresh. They changed the bread, which I don't like as much as the sea salt focaccia they used to have.  I love the egg on the croissant. This is my go to there. I am a savory person all the way, and I love this egg sandwich. It is one of the best in the city. I miss the random days they would do maple cured bacon. Now it's ham, but the ham is delicious. 

Downside is the price is definitely a bit steep for the size of the food. They also have very limited seating. This place is teeny.
author: Gabrielle C.

description: Stopped in here on a sunny SF day and really enjoyed it. Latte was great but they don't have non-fat, tried it with the Almond milk and liked it but would have preferred non-fat. The daily breakfast toast is wonderful, highly recommend. Local place that was very welcoming to a tourist. Busy, small place so plan to be flexible for seating. Staff is fantastic!
author: Jean H.

description:
********************* 1160 ********************* 

    Always love this spot for fresh coffee and brunch bite on the weekend. They change their sandwich regularly which I love it. A cute, quaint, coffee shop for all walk of life; Love it here.
author: Manda Bear B.

description: A delightful little place with fresh, simple fare. Service was gruff but not off-putting and very fast. They only had 6 things on the menu, which they executed perfectly. I had their homemade cereal with yogurt and fruit- tasty and simple. My husband had the tune melt that he described as "insane" with flavor, giving an approving nod after every bite. Coffee has some strong bitter notes so beware- not the toasty, smooth flavors of common drip coffee.
author: Erin G.

description:
The only reason why this isn't 5 stars is because of the limited seating arrangements.  There is only a picnic table inside as the space is very small.  The outside has a few tables set up or you can sit at the window looking inside.  The first time I tried to go on a weekend about 9am there was a line and no seating so I passed but I went again on a Monday at 9am assuming I missed the morning crowd and was glad to see no line and seating available.  I got sweet bun, some pressed juice, the pug and honey latte, the daily toast, and the broccoli savory tart.  I didn't try the bun or juice since those were for my son but the latte was very good.  It had a slightly unique sweetness to it.  The daily toast was good as well but nothing really amazing - but I also ate the fruit separately than the toast and spread because it was just so massive, I didn't know how to bite into it!  The spread and crispness of the toast were the highlights there.  The savory tart.  Oh man, the savory tart.  This was my favorite.  It was crisp and flaky on the outside and soft and moist on the inside like a quiche.  My 4-year old who hates anything green, especially vegetables not only ate it, but asked for more  - that's how good it was.

Somebody ship me another tart.
author: Julie P.

description: Super busy little place! Packed with people inside! Limited seating, but great atmosphere!
author: Dolores M.

description:
everyone goes ham for the daily toast, and now i can finally understand why. 

i came in the fall, and it was topped with persimmon, apples, grapes, figs, grapefruit, and pistachio nuts~ such a nice mix of flavors, textures, and color! 

paired it with their milk+ honey, which was really lovely. a layer of milk foam, and underneath the frothy layer was so delicious and delicate - it's like a warm toasty hug. 

it's nice to come here for a light breakfast, and would come back again when I'm in the neighborhood!
author: Tiffany S.

description:
I had the eggs on croissant and my girlfriend had the quiche (tart). Both were great, and the coffee too.

Really nice vibe, but get there early cause it's a small place that fills up quickly!
author: Erik V.

description:
I ordered the daily toast and as I sit here and wait I watched the young lady preparing it cut the fruit without cleaning her hands, eat some, wipe her nose on her arm, play with her hair, pick at her nails and touch a number of things in the restaurant including the screen to the iPad used to take orders and payment and something else outside of my view. After watching her scratch at her nose more I finally asked her if she wouldn't mind washing her hands before continuing with my food. She agreed to but should I have even had to ask? 

The toast and coffee cost me $11. I'm eating it because of the cost even though I'm grossed out. It's tasty but probably a bit over priced.

I would suggest they undergo food safety training.
author: Rosa R.

description:
Small venue (with out door seating) but everything at Farm:Table is TDF! They offer the same selection of ~4-5 meal items & also a half dozen drinks. Highly recommend the egg croissant (egg, ham, cheese, arugula) and the toast (creamy sweet spread with pistachios and fruits)

Best eats (not a super long line either) for less than $10!
author: Jennifer J.

description: Great choice for quick breakfast. Sandwich & coffe. Eat in and feel cozy (tiny space) or to go.
author: Altaf K.

description:
I was so intrigued that a teeny tiny coffee shop that offered only 4 prepared items on their menu would draw more than a thousand reviews. So I had to make the haul from the East Bay to here to see what the fuss was about.

Seating is super limited. A classic hole-in-the-wall with a communal table on the inside, a few bistro tables outside with parklet seating. But the cozy ambience, and getting to do a tiny bit of people-watching was worth the squeeze. 

Ordered:
Pug n Honey Latte: Smooth, velvety with just a touch of honey. Lovely way to start my day in the city.
Croissant Sandwich: Croissant was nicely toasted with a good balance of ham and eggs. I would definitely recommend doing the addition of avocado as it provides a better punch of creaminess and flavor for the combination.
